loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old and married with seven children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Elena has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as bread, beverages, canned good, biscuits, noodles, and other groceries.

Elena is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, eggs, personal care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, junk foods, eggs, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is a 24-year-old divorced woman with four children. For the past three years, she has run a small plantation where she grows cabbages, beans, and other produce to earn a living. Telesia has been a member of SBPD since 2012.

Telesia is requesting a loan to buy a weed sprayer, vegetable seeds, a wheelbarrow, rakes, knives, and other items. With her profits, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, vegetable seeds, a wheelbarrow, rakes, knives, and other items

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 37 years old, married with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mary Jane has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 49 years old and is a married woman with seven children. Three of her children are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Luisa has run a food vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Luisa is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Benelita

texts.en:
Ma. Benelita is 38 years old and married with two children, one children still in school, Ma. Benelita works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Benelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Ma. Benelita has been in this business for 5 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Tauesi

texts.en:
Tauesi is a 59 year old widow woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Tauesi has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, rakes, bush knives, weeds sprayer, fertilizer, plastic bags, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Tauesi hopes to spend it to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, wheel barrow, bush knives, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Taunese

texts.en:
Taunese is 54 years old and single with no child. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as food stocks, snacks, soft drinks, bags of sugars, bags of flour, materials, freezers, etc. 

She has been doing this for 3 years. Taunese needs a loan to purchase more goods to sell in her business. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy food stocks, soft drinks, freezers, snacks, materials, etc.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 32 years old, married with three children. He ventures in retailing business. 

He is also a member of PMPC where he recently loaned an amount of Php 10,000 for house renovation. Ramil hopes to live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: for house renovation

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene works hard to support her family. Marlene is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marlene requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like banana, sugar, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

Marlene has been in this business for 6 years now, and also earns additional income from general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like banana, sugar, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 53 years old and married with eight children.

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Lorna has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lorna aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marialyn is 33 years old and has one child still in school.

Marialyn has a buy and sell personal collection business in the Philippines. Marialyn requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products of personal collection like perfume, beauty soap, body lotion and other personal care products.

Marialyn has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products of personal collection like perfume, beauty soap, body lotion and other personal care products

loans.name: Maylen

texts.en:
Maylen is a married woman, 41 years old with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Maylen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maylen requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maylen has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nive

texts.en:
Nive is a 26 years old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Nive has requested a loan to buy bush knives, rakes, wheel barrow, vegetable seeds, weeds sprayer, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since June this year 2015. With her profits, Nive hopes to use it to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, wheel barrow, rakes, bush knives, weeds sprayer, etc.

loans.name: Dianne Mae

texts.en:
Dianne Mae wants to fulfill her dreams by completing  a degree. She religiously pays attention on making a good mark to every semester she entered. 

For another school year, Dianne Mae is in need of an amount to pay for her school fees. Dianne Mae has big dreams to help her family and for her siblings as well, reason why she works hard for her education

loans.use: to pay for her school fees

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.en:
Cipriano is from the village of Ozamiz City. He is 62 years old and is married. He has been engaged in his sari-sari store business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. 

He has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Cipriano is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional store inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 51 years old. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and planks. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails and planks for her house.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is widow with 10 children who lives in Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte. She has been in the cooperative since October 2009. 

She lend money to the cooperative to sustain the needs of her medication. Beatriz is thankful for the help given.

loans.use: for needed medication

loans.name: Isadora

texts.en:
Isadora  is 34 years old residing at Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married. She joined PMPC in the year 2009 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. 

Recently, she's accessing a loan amount of PHP 15,000 for additional working capital of her existing business to buy variety of commodities which she is selling in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities for her store

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. Mercedita is married and has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

Mercedita requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

Mercedita has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from buy and sell banana fruit.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Yolita

texts.en:
Yolita is 57 years old and married with six children. Yolita works very hard to provide for them.

Yolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Yolita has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as can goods, soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, beverages and other groceries. 

In the future, Yolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 51 years old and married with four children. Nimfa works very hard to provide for them.

Nimfa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Nimfa has been in this business for 2 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products

loans.name: Revelyn

texts.en:
Revelyn is 57 years old and married with five children. Revelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Revelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products to sell.

Revelyn has been in this business for 30 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products to sell

loans.name: Austeria

texts.en:
Austeria is 59 years old and has eleven children. Austeria is married and has two children who are in school.

Austeria is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Austeria requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Austeria has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Austeria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz , 37 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store along with her husband. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. She is a motivated mother and is helping her family by working really hard.  In order to run her household activities she makes sufficient amount of income through her business. 

Now, Mumtaz  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customers' demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc

loans.name: Augusto

texts.pt:
Augusto de 38 anos de idade, nasceu em Manhiça e é residente de Magude na casa própria, é casado maritalmente, pai de 2 filhos todos menores de idade, a sua esposa e estudante e além dos filhos tem sob sua responsabilidade a sua avó e mais um sobrinho.
Com o presente financiamento de 35.000 irá comprar cimento, janelas e chapas para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como sonhos se formar academicamente e oficializar o seu casamento.
Tem como desafios a insuficiência de fundos, mas tem recorrido ao trabalho e ao crédito para suprir as suas necessidades.
texts.en:
Augusto is 38 years old and comes from Manhiça. He lives in Magude in a house that he owns. He's in a common law marriage and has two underage children. His wife is a student. Aside from his children he's also responsible for his grandmother and a nephew.
With the current loan for 35,000mt he will purchase cement, windows and metal plates so that he can continue his construction work.
His dreams are to finish his degree and get officially married.
His challenge is the lack of funds, but he has been working and applying for credit as a way to meet his needs.

loans.use: to purchase cement, windows and metal plates so he can continue his construction work.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge ha sido un hombre muy pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por sus 2 hijos; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 20 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja sola todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productivo como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de pescado, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Jorge manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a sus hijos, para verlos convertirse en profesionales y tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Jorge has been a man very attentive to the care of his family, made up of his two children. He has always liked to work as an independent merchant. He began to sell merchandise 20 years ago. He is responsible for carrying the load of the household finances and needs to generate the resources to do so. 
His customers are neighbors, family members and friends in the area. He works alone at his business everyday and finds the advantage with his work that he can attend to his family at the same time that he manages to be a productive merchant. 

He is currently requesting a loan to buy an assortment of fish wholesale since it is a great opportunity during this time of the year. This will allow him to restock with more variety to satisfy the increasing demand. This will result in his family obtaining better income. 

Jorge says that his greatest dream is to be able to continue financially supporting his family and to educate his children. Also, to see them become professionals and to have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of fish wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase refreshments, beer, juice, flour, noodles and cooking oil for his stall, and also products such as blankets and secondhand clothes for re-selling.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta lives in Oroquieta City and supports her children by building houses from the ground up. She has successfully repaid her whole loan, which she used to buy building material, paints, and to pay her workers. 

She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material, paints & pay her workers

location.town: Oroquieta-Tui-an Dolipos Bajo, Oroq., Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Sokhom lives in Chnok Tru, a fishing community, and works as a commune council. He is married and the father of two children, and supplements his income from the commune council by fishing. He wants his children to pursue higher education to at least the bachelor degree; but they cannot study at night because the family lives in a remote area without access to power. The family uses a car battery for lighting at night, but the battery's life span is short, unreliable and prone to run out. That is why Sokhom is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a high-quality solar system for his home. It will allow his family to live in safety and his children to study at night time better than before.

loans.use: to pay for a home solar system.

location.town: Chhnok Tru Village,Chhnok Tru Commune, Boribo Dist

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rufa is 46 years old and has six children who are in school.

Rufa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rufa requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Rufa has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Rufa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Yozefina’S Group

texts.en:
Yozefina (first from the left) is a female aged 42, she is married with 5 children she is lives in Nyabubale village, Kibuga parish. Yozefina grows coffee, sorghum, bananas and she sustains her family through sale of crop produces. She also owns a small retail shop in her village.

Yozefina leads a group of other four farmers that joined YICEs program where they were trained on farming as business. These trainings helped the group to appreciate the use of better farming methods so as to mazimize productivity. As a result, the group is now requesting for a small loan to purchase farm inputs, tools and good quality seeds so as to improve their productivity. 

Yozefina’s dream is to become a role model farmer in her community, helping other farmers adopt good farming methods. She plans to use her income from sale of produces to expand her garden and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, tools and good quality seeds so as to improve their productivity.

loans.name: Sophin

texts.en:
Sophin and wife(both in the picture standing in-front of their house) are farmers living with 5 children in Kraing Skea village. Beside farming on his 4 hectares land, Sophin sells charcoal to earn extra income. He starts business from small land to bigger and bigger land and improves his family condition well. Sophin's goal is to expand his business to be famous in his area and also reduce family expense. 

However, his house has no reliable energy source. Car battery is a time and money consuming source. He has to go to charge car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. As a result, Sophin decided to apply for KIVA loan to buy high quality home solar energy to full fill his goal. 

After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition would be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Kraing Skea Village, Kraing Skea Commune, Toek Pho

loans.name: Oso

texts.en:
Oso is a 30 years old woman who is single with 2 children. She runs a business selling and sewing elei clothes in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business.

Oso has requested a loan to buy materials, a sewing machine, thread, needles etc.  She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to pay for her children's education . She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, thread, scissors, unpicker, needles

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine signed up for membership with PMPC and obtained the capital she needed to start a sari-sari store business. She is thankful to have access to help like this for a small-time borrower like her. Catherine has been able to improve her life thanks to good sales and wants to take advantage of this good fortune. That is why she is requesting a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is a businesswoman from Oroquieta. She is 43 years old, married and has the expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Annabel is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, she applied a loan to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Annabel continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha, a farmer with 4 children, lives in Prey Gneam village that is far from power grid. Working as a farmer and also a factory worker, Tha has a stable income and enhances his business well. Nowadays, his 2 biggest children has started working and earn a stable income to improve family condition. 

Currently, he wants to improve his family energy source. His house has no reliable energy source. He has to go to charge car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometime because of busyness he doesn’t have time to charge battery the whole family is in pitch black condition for the whole day. 

He is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a high quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition would be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Prey Gneam Village, Svay Chork Commue, Samaki Mean

loans.name: Je Ka Fo Group

texts.fr:
Mahamadou C’est l’homme qui tient la corde du bœuf sur la photo. Mahamadou est un Malien. Il est alphabétisé. Mahamadou est âgé de 38 ans. Marié, sa femme fait le petit commerce. Père de 4 enfants âgé de 3 à 13 ans. Les 3 enfants ne sont pas scolarisés mais un enfant est à l’école coranique. Il est cultivateur, il cultive le riz, le mil, arachide, …etc. 
Il prend le prêt au RMCR pour acheter des bœufs pour l’embouche. Il fait ses achats au marché environnant. Après l’engraissement il les revend chez lui-même ou au marché environnant. Le bénéfice récolté sur la vente des bœufs lui permet de prendre en charge : la santé, la nourriture et l’habillement de ses enfants. Il déclare n’avoir pas eu de problème avec le prêt du RMCR. Mon rêve pour l’avenir c’est avoir un prêt conséquent pour développer mon activité d’élevage  afin de satisfaire suffisamment à ses besoins et ceux de ma famille.
texts.en:
Mahamadou is the man holding the cattle’s rope in the photo. He is Malian. He is illiterate, 38 years old, and married. His wife has a small-scale business. And he is the father of four children, from 3 to 13 years old. Three of the children are not in school, but one is in Koran school. Mahamadou is a farmer of rice, millet, peanuts, …etc. 

He is taking out a loan from RMCR to purchase cattle to raise. He makes his purchases at the nearby market. After fattening them, he resells them at his own place or at the nearby market. The profits gotten from the sales of cattle enable him to support his children: healthcare, food, and clothing. He states that he has not had problems with RMCR loans and “My dream for the future is to have a significant loan for developing my livestock business, so as to meet the needs of my family adequately”.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell

loans.name: Tegwende Songtaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est responsable du groupe TEGWENDE SONGTAABA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 03 vont à l'école et elle a 01personne en charge.
Mme fait l’élevage depuis 05ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans un village environnant.
Elle veut s'acheter 03 moutons et des aliments pour bétail.
Avec ses bénéfice, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. FATIMATA is the official of the group TEGWENDE SONGTAABA. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 18, and the youngest is 2. Three go to school. She has one person to support. 

Ms. FATIMATA has been raising livestock for five years. She gets her supplies from a nearby village. She wants to purchase 3 sheep and some animal feed. With the profits, she wants to reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to provide education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sheep and some animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candies, biscuits, canned goods, feed and also pay her daughter's school fees

loans.name: Gloria

texts.pt:
A senhora Glória de 49 anos de idade, nasceu em Magude e é residente de Magude na casa própria,  casada e mãe de 2 filhos maiores de idade e independentes.
Com o presente financiamento de 20.000 irá comprar ração, arroz, óleo e omo para reforçar o seu negócio.
Tem como sonhos crescer no negócio, adquirir uma viatura para auxiliar no seu negócio e abrir um armazém de venda de produtos.
Tem como desafios a insuficiência de fundos, mas tem recorrido ao negócio e ao crédito para suprir as suas necessidades.
texts.en:
Glória is 49 years old. She comes from Magude and lives there in a house that she owns. She's married and has two adult, independent children.
With the current loan for 20,000 she'll purchase feed, rice, rice, cooking oil and laundry detergent to stock her business.
Her dreams are to make her business grow, buy a vehicle to use in her business and open a grocery store.
Her challenge is the lack of funds, but she has been turning to her business and to loans as a way of meeting her needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed, rice, rice, cooking oil and laundry detergent to stock her business.

loans.name: Celefina

texts.pt:
Celefina de 38 anos de idade, nasceu em Magude e é residente de Magude na casa própria, viúva, mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 1 é maior de idade e vive na vizinha Africa do Sul e 2 menores frequentando o ensino primário. 
Com o presente financiamento de 15.000 irá comprar janelas para montar na sua casa.
Tem como sonhos construir um aviário para a prática de avicultura e também quer melhorar as condições da sua casa.
Tem como desafios a insuficiência fundos, mas tem recorrido ao trabalho e ao crédito para resolver seus pendentes.
texts.en:
Celefina is 38 years old. She comes from Magude and lives there in a house that she owns. She's a widow and has three children, one of whom is an adult and lives in neighboring South Africa. Her two underage children are in primary school.
With the current loan for 15,000mt she'll purchase windows that she'll set up in her house.
Her dream is to build an aviary for poultry farming. She also dreams of improving her living conditions.
Her challenge is the lack of funds, but she has been working and applying for credit as a way to settle her affairs.

loans.use: to purchase windows that she'll set up in her house.

loans.name: Lacercia

texts.pt:
Lacêrcia de 23 anos de idade, nasceu em Matola e é residente de Magude na casa dos seus pais, é estudante, solteira e mãe de 1 filho recém nascido.
Com o presente financiamento de 10.000 irá comprar pinto, rações e vacinas para dar continuidade a criação de frangos de engorde na casa dos pais.
Tem como sonhos aumentar o volume da sua criação e se formar academicamente.
Tem como desafios a insuficiência de fundos, mas tem recorrido ao negócio e ao crédito para suprir as suas necessidades.
texts.en:
Lacêrcia is 23 years old. She comes from Matola and lives with her parents in Magude. She's a student and a single mother to a newborn son.
With the current loan for 10,000mt she'll purchase chicks, feed and vaccines so she can continue raising chickens for fattening at her parents' house.
Her dreams are to expand her chicken farm and get an academic degree.
Her challenge is the lack of funds, but she has been turning to her business and to credit as a way of meeting her needs.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vaccines so she can continue raising chickens for fattening.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is 35 years old, married, and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She invests in a fishing business that sustains her family's needs. Merlinda is also a member of PMPC where she recently requested a loan to purchase an additional boat for fishing. She is thankful for the help given.

loans.use: to purchase an additional boat for fishing

loans.name: Odelia

texts.en: Odelia is managing her snack-vending business in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. Recently she was loaned an amount to purchase meat, spices, oil, etc. for her snack-vending business. She wants to expand her business and would like to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: To purchase meat, spices, oil, etc. for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Immaculate's Group

texts.en:
Immaculate (first from the left) is 31, married, the mother of four children and a resident of Kivengenyi parish, Kivengenyi village. She is a farmer who grows beans, cassava, maize, and millet. She also raises goats, chicken and sheep, and earns her income by selling her crops and running a small food store. 

Immaculate and the other members of her loan group are beneficiaries of YICE’s trainings on farming as a business. The knowledge and skills they have acquired have enabled them realize how profitable farming is, and they are eager to apply what they have learned. They are therefore requesting a loan to buy farm supplies like tools, fertilizers and herbicides which will boost their output in terms of quality and quantity. 

Immaculate’s dream is to construct a home and expand her food store. She is confident that with this Kiva loan and continued support from YICE, she will be able to achieve this dream.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to boost their yields

loans.name: Immaculate’S Group

texts.en:
Immaculate is 37 years old. She is a single mother with three children. Immaculate, (first from the left) was selected by her group members and their leader because of her literacy abilities and honesty. She is a farmer and earns her income through the sale of crops like tomatoes, maize, beans and cassava. She also rears chicken and ducks. 

Immaculate and her group attend farming-as-a-business trainings organized by YICE and have acquired the skills to improve their crop productivity. As a result, they request a loan to be able to purchase fertilizers, good-quality seeds and farm inputs to boost their farm productivity. 

Immaculate and her group's members plan to establish a joint vegetable garden from which they will earn income to pay back the loan. Immaculate’s dream is to establish a residential house and feed her children well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, good-quality seeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a member of PMPC. She is 25 years old, married, and has a business selling snacks in the town of Plaridel. This is how she supports her family with an income of PHP 5,000 per month. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase thatch for roofing. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership in the cooperative.

loans.use: to buy thatch to make a roof.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.pt:
Marcelino de 31 anos de idade, nasceu em Magude e é residente de Magude na casa própria, casado e pai de 2 filhos menores de idade. Além dos filhos tem sob sua responsabilidade o seu cunhado e conta com ajuda do seu irmão.
Com o presente financiamento de 15.000 irá comprar ovos, farinha de trigo, farinha de milho, velas, fósforos e produtos de cabelo para revender na sua banca em casa, bem como produtos de cabelo para o seu salão de cabeleireiro.
Tem como sonhos se tornar um homem de sucesso no negócio e ter alguma criação  de animais.
Tem como desafios a insuficiência fundos, mas tem recorrido ao trabalho, negócio e ao crédito para resolver seus pendentes.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 31 years old. He comes from Magude and lives there in a house that he owns. He's married and has two underage children. Aside from his children he's also responsible for his brother-in-law and he gets help from his brother.
With the current loan for 15,000mt he'll purchase eggs, wheat flour, corn flour, candles, matches and hair products for re-selling in the booth he owns at his house. He'll also purchase hair products for his hairdressing salon.
His dreams are to become a successful businessman and to own an animal farm.
His challenge is the lack of funds, but he has been turning to his work, his business and credit as a way to settle his affairs.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, wheat flour, corn flour, candles, matches and hair products.

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en: Virgenia is driven by passion in selling. Everyday she never gets tired tending her store. Virgenia is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now she borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventory of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase four cattle units for slaughtering and then selling.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en: Bonifacia is 63 years old, married, and lives in Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is investing in her sari-sari store business which supports her family's needs. She is a member of the cooperative where she requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to pay for inventory of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Bonifacia is thankful for the help given.

loans.use: to pay for inventory of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en: Filipina is 68 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed one child. She joined PMPC in March 2010 to have access to the programs and services offered by the coop. She is requesting a new loan for PHP 4,500 to buy variety of commodities to sell to people who live in her community.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en: Isabelita is 64 years old, married and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She ventures in a business selling "hypo" [calcium hypochlorite, a disinfectant], from which she generates income for her family. Isabelita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since 2010. Recently she has availed a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional stock of hypo to sell. Isabelita is thankful for the help given.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of "hypo" (bleaching liquid) to sell

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita wishes that her variety store will progress someday, thus she exerts her best effort to make it stable. She lives in Caloocan City together with her husband Jaime and their three children. They are living in a community where people are quite familiar with each other. Therefore Nenita finds it difficult to refuse her neighbors who pay late for the goods they get from her store. This practice shakes the stability of her business.

To continue with her business, she requests additional capital of PHP 22,000 to buy more items for her inventory. It will improve her profit and will help sustain their everyday needs. It will also contribute some steps to her dream of enjoying a little comfort in the near future. She is praying that you will be one of God’s instruments to help her. She will really appreciate your kind support.   

Nenita is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items for her variety store

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
A senhora Luísa de 31 anos de idade, nasceu em Chibuto e é residente de Magude na casa própria, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos menores de idade, dos quais 2 frequentam o ensino primário e o outro é recém nascido. Além dos filhos tem na sua responsabilidade o seu pai.
Com o presente financiamento de 20.000 irá comprar panelas, capulanas, peixe e patas para revender em casa e por entrega para posterior recolha dos valores nos finais do mês.
Tem como sonhos construir uma casa muito grande, uma casa de banho para dar conforto a sua família.
Tem como desafios a insuficiência fundos, mas tem recorrido ao negócio e ao crédito para resolver seus pendentes.
texts.en:
Luísa is 31 years old. She comes from Chibuto and lives in Magude in a house that she owns. She's single and has three underage children, two of whom are in primary school and the other one is a newborn. Aside from her children she's also responsible for her father.
With the current loan for 20,000mt she'll purchase pans, traditional skirts, fish and ducks for re-selling from home. She delivers and then collects payments at the end of the month.
Her dreams are to build a very big house and a bathroom in order to provide comfort for her family.
Her challenge is the lack of funds, but she has been turning to her business and to credit as a way to settle her affairs.

loans.use: to purchase pans, traditional skirts, fish and ducks for re-selling from home.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a businesswoman from Pagadian. She is 38 years old, married and a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She runs a snack vending business near a school. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially the education of her children. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bananas, oil, sugar, flour, etc., for snack vending. She believes having enough inventory will allow her to cater to her customers' needs. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, oil, sugar, flour, etc., for a snack vending business

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en: Cirila is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. Cirila hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 10,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Cirila has made her obligations to the cooperative a priority so she can always turn to it for any financial help.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Norlyn

texts.en: Norlyn  is 50 years old and resides at Eastern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Recently she requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy a variety of commodities for her existing business, which is selling a variety of food products in the local community. Norlyn hopes to sustain her business so that she can save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce (first from left) is 38 years old and a resident of Kabaka village in Karusandara parish. She is married with five children. She is a smallholder farmer growing cassava, beans, maize, vegetables and bananas. She earns her income through the sale of crop produce and also has a small business in her community. 

She leads a group of four farmers that have participated in YICE’s trainings on farming as business. The group has learned that the use of modern farming technologies improve productivity. They are requesting a small loan so as to buy good-quality seeds, fertilizers and herbicides for their gardens.

Joyce’s dream is to become a leading female farmer producing good-quality maize in her community. She plans to use her extra income to expand her garden and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy good-quality seeds, fertilizers and herbicides for their gardens.

loans.name: Eva

texts.pt:
Eva de 30 anos de idade, nasceu em Magude e é residente de Magude na casa própria, casada, mãe de 5 filhos menores de idade, mas so vive com 1 deles, os outros vivem com o pai e frequentam o ensino primário. 
Com o presente financiamento de 20.000 irá comprar menchas, tissagens, tops, nivea e super blackc para o seu salão de beleza.
Tem como sonhos expandir o seu negócio, construir uma casa grande e mobilar.
Tem como desafios a insuficiência fundos, mas tem recorrido ao negócio e ao crédito para satisfazer suas necessidades.
texts.en:
Eva is 30 years old. She comes from Magude and lives there in a house that she owns. She's married and has five underage children, only one of whom lives with her. The other children live with their father and attend primary school.
With the current loan for 20,000mt she will purchase hair extensions, weaves, tops, Nivea products and hair dye for her beauty salon.
Her dreams are to expand her business, build a big house and furnish it.
Her challenge is the lack of funds, but she has been turning to her business and to credit as a way of meeting her needs.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, weaves, tops, Nivea products and hair dye for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita, 52, lives in Caloocan City and is married to Mateo, a driver. They have five children, three of whom are still studying. In addition to paying the fees for her children in school, she works hard to support and maintain the household’s daily expenses.

Margarita operates a “sari-sari” store, a type of small convenience store in the Philippines. There she sells fresh, dry and packaged commodities, with almost all of her products being essential household items and food. She buys these goods at wholesale prices, then sells them by the piece to her neighbors and the local community. This type of store is very common in the Philippines, and expectedly the competition is stiff. Sometimes Margarita’s income cannot suffice for their everyday expenses. Fortunately, her husband’s income though irregular, can compensate for some of their needs. 

Margarita’s plan to enhance her business remains strong and she appeals for a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, sachets and packs of toiletries, and many others. She knocks at your generous heart. Your help will be a big answer to her prayers. 

Margarita has high dreams for her children. She wishes that they can attend a decent school to gain better education, and better education is a key to a better living condition someday. She is a faithful member of CCT Credit Cooperative who meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Betty Luz

texts.es:
Betty es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica de 35 años de edad, comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 3 años comenzó a vender bebidas y cerveza a sus familiares y amigos, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor de este tipo de bebidas de diferentes marcas, brindando mayor variedad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.

Trabaja con 1 empleado todos los días durante 12 horas.

Betty tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar y sabe que con los prestamistas de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar puede lograr todo eso y más.
texts.en:
Betty is an entrepreneurial and dynamic woman of 35. She is an independent businesswoman, since three years ago she began to sell beverages and beer to her relatives and friends, with the goal of generating income to support her household economy.

The loan that she is applying for is an aid to strengthening her business, since she will invest the money in the wholesale purchase of different brands of these types of beverages, thus offering greater variety and better service to her customers, which will make her business more profitable.

She works every day for 12 hours, with one employee.

Betty has the firm commitment to advancing her profitable project, since she wants to become a successful businesswoman and guarantee a better quality of life and well-being for her family group. She knows that with the Kiva lenders and the Interactuar Corporation she can achieve all this and more.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and beer in quantity to stock her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Good day to you lenders! Helen extends her warm appreciation to you for your previous assistance worth PHP 40,000. It has been utilized in purchasing more supplies of dry goods and grocery items for her variety store, which consequently gave additional income for her family.

Now she still longs to continue improving her business. That is why she appeals for a PHP 45,000 loan this time. Again, she will buy additional supplies of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her variety store. Wide selections in her store will surely make it more enticing to customers. 

She has been consistent in repaying her previous loan and she’s determined to maintain her integrity. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jannier

texts.es:
Jannier tiene 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, con su conyuge y sus 4 menores hijos de 15,12,6 y 3 años de los cuales los dos primeros cursan secundaria y el otro primaria en colegio nacional.vive en la parte rural del distrito de Sallique, contando con servicios de agua y luz, que pertenece a la provincia de Jaén , Región Cajamarca,Sierra Norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza es elaboración y venta de productos de panaderia en base a leña, las ventas lo realiza en su mismo distrito, cuenta con clientela de la zona. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de insumos y arreglos a su horno, con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en: Jannier is 37 years old. He lives in his own house made of rustic materials, with his wife and 4 small children ages 15, 12, 6 and 3 years old. The first two children are in high school and th other child is in elementary at a public school. He lives in the rural part of the Sallique district which has water and electricity, and belongs to the province of Jaen, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. He works preparing and selling baked goods made with firewood. He sells in his own district, having a customer base in the zone. The loan will be used to buy inputs and to repair his oven. This way he will be able to make greater income and thus, improve his quality of life. There is no major competition in this industry and he is able to get better prices.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and to repair his oven.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 57 years old, married with three children.

Laura works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Laura has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 32 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Laura aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
One has to be very patient in managing trucking services especially in a country like the Philippines where traffic is quite congested, some of the drivers are not very disciplined, and local authorities have little concern whatsoever. 

Some months ago, local authorities of Manila enforced a longer truck ban in the city where trucks are not allowed on the roads of Manila during certain times of day and night. It resulted to slow distribution of products and the infamous port congestion in the port of Manila. Consequently, prices of products went high and trucking services had experienced huge loss. Just recently, Manila authorities gave in to public clamor and realized that they were slowing down the economy affecting all stakeholders, the producers, the distributors, and most especially the consumers. 

Ludivina, from Caloocan City, was one of those truck operators who had this crisis. She and her husband, Jimmy, a truck driver, long to regain their deficit now that trucking operations are back to normal. Ludivina needs additional capital of PHP 16,000 to buy spare parts for the truck and pay for its repair. This loan will ensure the continuous operation of her business, paving the way to a more stable income. She hopes that you can help her at this time of business recovery.

She remains faithful in attending the regular meeting of her co-fellowship members at CCT where she gains the patience and strength through sharing of life experiences and study of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the truck and pay for its repair.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Filipinos are known to be resilient and tough. Comparable to bamboo trees, they are bent but not broken. They also gather strength through togetherness and camaraderie.

This is the exact description of how Evelyn was able to rise above difficult situations in her life. One of her children got a serious illness and her whole family exerted all efforts for his recovery. Same is true when it comes to her variety store and RTW [ready-to-wear clothing] business. The income from her business goes up and down, nevertheless, all members of her family contribute what they can in order to sustain their needs. Her husband Rowell is a taxi driver, and he takes turns looking after the store when he is not on driving duty. Their children also do the same during their vacant hours after school.

However, the family's effort is not enough to earn adequately and sustain their increasing expenses, especially during emergencies. What Evelyn needs is additional capital of PhP 15,000 to buy more RTW products and supplies for her variety store. She can gain more profit from this loan which will lead to her family's improved way of life.

Evelyn dreams of a successful life and career for her children after they finish their college education. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more RTW [ready-to-wear] products and supplies for her variety store.

loans.name: N3-Phố 7-Quảng Thắng-Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huyền is 41 years old and she is married with three children. She has had a manufacturing business, making stone furniture, for four years. Huyền lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Huyền faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase material to manufacture and sell stone for building stairs. In 2014, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Huyền has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Huyền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase material to manufacture and sell stone for building stairs.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane.

Mary Grace dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Khoi

texts.en: Mrs. Khoi is a hardworking woman who is 34 years old. She is married and has a baby. She works very hard to feed & education her children. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially for her children, but lacks capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she will be able to repay the loan from cultivation, husbandry and hired labor.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: N1Thôn Đông Quảng Nham - Happy Old Women Group

texts.en:
Nên is group leader of the "N1Thôn Đông Quảng Nham - Happy Old Women" group. She lives in Quang Xuong, a coast district in Thanh Hoa Province. She is a fisherwoman. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, this region often suffers by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. The main hardship that Nên faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for fishing.

In 2007, Nên joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Nên has successfully repaid nine loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profits, Nên hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for fishing.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 33-year-old divorced father with one daughter. He has been working as a barber for eighteen years to cover the needs and expenses of his family. After his divorce, Ahmad has taken care of his daughter, for he is her only breadwinner.

Ahmad is working hard and trying desperately to develop his business and improve his family's living conditions. Today, he is seeking a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay his daughter's school tuition fees.
 
In the future, Ahmad hopes to expand his business to increase his income and stay capable of providing his daughter with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 40 years old from the town of Alcantara in Cebu. She is married with two sons, aged 17 and 22. 

She has been raising hogs for six years now which allow her to support the basic needs of her family, like food and household expenses. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy additional piglets, feed, and to pay for tuition fees. Marivic is motivated to work hard for her children and for more future investments.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and pay for tuition fee

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
A sari-sari, or variety store appeals to customers if it has a wide variety of selections. This is the reason Yolanda wants to avail a PHP 25,000 loan to buy a volume of supplies like grocery items and dry goods. This additional stock will enhance the competitiveness of her store within their community. If her sari-sari will grow into a big grocery store according to her plan, her husband Norberto, a 71-year-old deliveryman, may already retire. 

She hopes that she can earn enough to meet their basic needs and enjoy a better living condition. Moreover, she prays that she and her husband can retire without worries. She wishes that you can lighten her burden through your kind assistance. May God bless you more. 

Yolanda meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a volume of supplies like grocery items and dry goods.

loans.name: Lesvy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lesvy es madre de 3 hijos entre los 14 y 18 años. Aparte a su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 4 años. 

Ella aprendió este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de observación de otras personas. 

Ella y su familia viven una zona rural de Valencia, Colombia en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que aporta Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo va usar para comprar insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para poder preparar sus cultivos. 

Gracias a este crédito, la economía de su familia y la calidad de vida mejorarían pues pudiera aumentar sus ingresos. 

¡Impacte la vida de Lesvy y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Lesvy is the mother of three children between the ages of 14 and 18. Aside from her family, she has been working in agriculture for four years.

She learned this business empirically, that is to say, through observation of other people.

She and her family live in a rural zone of Valencia, Colombia, where it is not easy to have access to financial services such as those that Interactuar provides.

She is going to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, products to control pests, and compost to be able to prepare her plantings.

Thanks to this loan, the economy of her family and their quality of life will improve, since she will be able to increase her income.

Impact the life of Lesvy and her family with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, products to control pests, and compost to be able to prepare her plantings.

loans.name: Mui

texts.en: Mrs. Mui is 48 years old. She is married and has three children, so she works very hard to provide for them. Small business is the main income of her family. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family’s living standard, as well as environment protection.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to finance her farming activities. Nicanora has been able to turn the tide in her favor, and is making good income these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she took a loan to purchase additional farm inputs and fertilizers for her farm. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional farm inputs and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita has ventures in a hypo-selling business to support her children. She used her loan to purchase additional stock on "hypo” to sell in her business. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of "hypo" (bleaching liquid) to sell.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock and through a general store business. Lolita is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Amparo Maria

texts.es:
Amparo de 31 años, es casada y no tiene hijos, desde hace 2 años tiene una tienda de abarrotes  la cual atiende en compañía de su esposo. 
Tiene como sueño ampliar su tienda donde distribuye artículos como leche, granos, verduras, lácteos y otros. 

En la actualidad tiene poco surtido y esto es perjudicial ya que no puede suplir con muchos productos que le pide su clientela. 

Amparo, en vista de esto, optó en solicitar un préstamo con el fin de organizarse más y comprar al por mayor el surtido necesario como granos, azúcar, galletería, lácteos para incrementar su oferta y poder brindar mejor atención a las personas,  esto le representaría también el aumento en sus ingresos para cumplir necesidades básicas de todo negocio como son los servicios públicos, impuestos, y demás; mejorara también el bienestar de ella y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Amparo, 31, is married and has no children.  She opened up a grocery store 2 years ago which she manages along with her husband.  Her dream is to expand her store, where she sells items such as milk, grains, vegetables, dairy products, and other items.

At this time she is low on stock, and this is detrimental because she is not able to supply many products that her customers demand.

Seeing this, Amparo chose to request a loan so that she can organize herself and buy at wholesale the the supplies she needs, such as grains, sugar, biscuits, and dairy products.  This way she can increase her offerings and provide better service to the public,enabling her to increase her earnings so that she can fund the basic requirements of her business such as public services, taxes, and other items.  This will also improve her well-being and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Nham

texts.en: Mrs. Nham is a hardworking woman and is 32 years old.  She is married and has three children. She needs a loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve the health of her family members and also for environment protection. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and a salary, so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: N1 Thôn Hòa Quảng Nham - Fresh Fish Group

texts.en:
In 2012, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. The loans helped her to much improve her income. She is a group leader of "N1 Thôn Hòa Quảng Nham - Fresh Fish" group now.

Her household was recognized by local government as poor; moreover, this region often suffers by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. The main hardship that Hương faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools for fishing. With her business profits, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for fishing.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre muy emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 5 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos mercancía muy variada como zapatos, artículos para el hogar, elementos en barro, entre otros, estos productos los vende principalmente en el municipio de Medellín.

Desde muy niño sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar algunas mejoras locativas en su negocio, lo que le permitirá tener más espacio para trabajar  atender mejor a sus clientes.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos y al acompañamiento de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very entrepreneurial man with a great will to get ahead and make progress.

For five years he has been selling a variety of products such as shoes, household articles, and clay items, among other things. He sells these products principally in the city of Medellín.

Since he was a young boy, he has felt great affinity for business and sales, and for this reason he now has great abilities in this area, thanks to his friendliness and his excellent quality of service.

He is applying for a loan to make some improvements in his business location, which will allow him to have more space to work and better serve his customers.

He has the hope of being able to get ahead thanks to the support of the kind-hearted people who support this type of projects and the backing of the Interactuar Corporation.

loans.use: to improve his sales space, seeking to have a bigger and more pleasant space to serve his customers

loans.name: Sukhbaatar

texts.en:
Sukhbaatar, 59 years old, lives with his wife in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as a crane operator at a construction company for three years. His wife has retired from work and receives a state pension. Their only daughter lives in Ulaanbaatar on her own. 

Using his previous loan, he has purchased an electric car and generates extra income as a cab driver. This time he is requesting a loan of $3,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam to renovate his house. The house he and his wife live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs urgent repair. After the house is renovated, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutants into the air. 

Sukhbaatar is one of the most reliable clients and pays his loan without any delay.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Rathary

texts.en:
Rathary is 42 years old and lives in Chroy Changva district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has been married since 1986 and has one son and one daughter.

Currently her son studies at university in Phnom Penh. He is studying for his bachelor of arts and is in year one, semester one. So Rathary needs to apply for a loan to Maxima to pay for his school fees.

She hopes for her son and wants his future to be bright.

loans.use: To pay for her son's school fees.

loans.name: Chela

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Chela works hard to support her family.

She has a personal care products business in the Philippines. Chela is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of personal care products to sell to customers.

Chela has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Norma is 53 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Norma has a general store business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Norma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Norma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jipe Moyo Yombo Group

texts.en:
Araita, who is in her mid 20s, is single with one son who is still small. She has been selling ladies clothes for four years now. She sells door to door and works from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Araita's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the clothing stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support. She used the profit to take care of her child and herself, to repay the loan, to bank some in her bank account and to cover household expenses. 

She will use this loan to buy the fast moving styles of clothes to sell during Ramadan (Muslim fasting period). She dreams of opening a shop for selling her clothes in one place.  

Araita will share this loan with her loan group, Jipe Moyo Yombo, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving styles of clothes to sell  during Ramadan (Muslim fasting period).

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business. Angeline successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Angeline's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Arlyn

texts.en:
Maria Arlyn is 47 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Maria Arlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Maria Arlyn has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from retailing purified water.

Maria Arlyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add capital to her mobile money  business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fresh fish

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a feed and rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of feed and rice to resell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like her general store and raising pigs businesses.

Teresita dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of feed and rice to resell.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 57 years old and has three children. 

Belinda is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Belinda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies.

Belinda has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Belinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is an accountant and earns his side income from farming growing beans, bananas and maize. He has been in this service for 10 years, working 8 hours 6 days a week and he has even gained experience from it. He is hardworking and he has a dream of expanding his business and educating his children although he is faced with poor climatic conditions like heavy sunshine which limits his dreams. He wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sama Group

texts.en:
Sarah is the featured borrower for Sama Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Sarah is a 26-year-old single lady who started a year ago working as a tattoo artist to cover her needs and expenses. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying desperately to develop her business. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a new updated tattoo machine, which will facilitate her business and provide her customers with better service. Sarah is the first lady on the left. 

With respect to the other group members, Hanaa is the second lady on the left, Hawraa is the second lady on the right, and Mariam is the first lady on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new updated tattoo machine

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 42-year-old Syrian married mother of three children. Five years ago she began tailoring from her house to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family. She gained professional skills in this domain after few training sessions. She is a hard worker who has her own loyal customers. 

Today, Wissam is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through buying a new updated tailoring machine which will facilitate her work and allow her to provide her customers with better and quicker service. 

Wissam hopes to expand her business more in the future and open her own tailoring shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new updated tailoring machine

loans.name: 09 Đa Phạn Hải Lộc - Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngọc is 28 years old and she is married. Ngọc lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. 
 
She has had a retail business of selling cakes, sweets, sugar, milk and general things for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Ngọc faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar and milk to resell.

This is Ngọc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. With her business profit, Ngọc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar and milk to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds for planting for high production and supply in the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Leidy Vanesa

texts.es:
Leidy, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica para su hijo de 2 años, inicio con un negocio de masajes corporales y faciales prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de Medellín, Antioquia, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de herramientas como masajeadores y cremas, así podrá prestar un mejor servicio y podrá mantener a flote su servicio.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Leidy a continuar con su proyecto de vida!¡
texts.en:
Leidy, in her tireless quest for a better life and better financial stability for her two-year-old son, started a body and facial massage business; she provides her services in homes in the municipality of Medellín, Antioquia, a city where drive and tenacity are very important ideals for area residents.

She works every day on an extremely varied schedule, and is always busy, as she is very sought after for her good work.

She is requesting a financial boost in order to make the purchase of equipment like massagers and creams in order to provide a better service and to be able to keep her service afloat.

Today, she feels glad about the good job that she has done up to now, and that she has been allowed to enjoy more stable work.

With a loan, you will be able to support Leidy in continuing with her life's work!
