texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo, posee 8 años de experiencia agrícola, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa,  la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para pago de alquiler de terreno y la compra de insumo como: fertilizantes, herbicidas e insecticida por mayor y asi poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman who has her face pixelated is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area.  She grows corn, beans, and sorghum.  She has eight years of experience in agriculture.  She sells her products at the different markets that are close to her house.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children.

She is requesting a loan to pay the rent on the land and to buy supplies like fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides wholesale.  This way she will be able to continue with her work.  It is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides wholesale.

loans.name: Meryem

texts.en:
Meryem, 53 years old, is married and has two children. She works hard to support her family and improve their income. Meryem's husband also supports the family with work as a driver. The family's main source of income is the growing of seasonal vegetables (onions, greens, etc.). Meryem has been raising vegetables for 30 years and has good skills in this area.

Greens and onions are very popular in Azerbaijan national cuisine. They are used in cooking kebab, levengi, qutab, doghramajh and other dishes, and therefore are in high demand. Meryem grows and then sells them at the local bazaar.

Meryem's income from this small business doesn’t cover life's demands. Her harvest isn’t profitable enough and she plans to also raise other vegetables and fruits. Meryem applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy new good fertilizers and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new good fertilizers and expand her business.

loans.name: Jorge Eliseo

texts.es: Jorge de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus 4 hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo posee 20 años de dedicarse a esa actividad de la cual ha podido salir adelante, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ganancias y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge, age 49, lives in his own house with his four children.  He grows corn and sorghum.  He has been engaged in this business activity for 20 years.  Through this business he has been able to get ahead.  He sells his products in surrounding villages.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and pesticides, etc.  This way he will continue with his work in order to have greater earnings and to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and pesticides, etc.

loans.name: N3 Mật Thôn Thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hưng, 34 years old, is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general items for more than 10 years. Hưng lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household; moreover, the market need is low in this region. 

Hưng's main hardship is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase ice cream to resell. This is Hưng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. With her business profit, Hưng hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children and to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing to get better produce for family use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the purchase of ZEduPads to equip his school with education technology that will help maximize his aim to provide quality education to the children at his school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a hammer for crushing big stones into small ones, commonly called 'kokoto' used by construction

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Cristina is 38 years old, married to Wilson, and supports a family of four children. 

She has been practicing dairy farming for the last eight years earning KES 16,000 per month. 

Christina has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk in the market for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to expand her agricultural business. 

Her future hopes and dreams include being financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk in the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana is a 58-year-old woman from the town of Badian, Cebu. She is married with one adult daughter. Damiana has been farming rice and raising hogs for 20 years now. 

She is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP from CEVI to buy fertilizer and feed. Not only did Damiana raise hogs, but she is raising a sow, which will soon produce piglets, and with the loan, it will prepare her for more income in the near future. 

Damiana hopes to expand her business someday for better sustainability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 19 years old. She is studying International Relations and Strategic Studies, and she is an example of the superior girl in university, but this is not strange for a girl who lives in one of the archaeological areas. Perhaps Sofia was inspired by the hope and resilience of these areas.

Her hopes are without borders. Although, she faced financial difficulties, which prevented her from paying tuition, but this did not stop her from trying to achieve her dream.

Sofia requested an educational loan to help her cover her university fees. She wants to graduate and find good work to help her increase her income and help her family with their expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a 21-year-old single man living in Baqaa with his family. His dad is retired with a very low income. 

Abdalla is studying accounting in his fourth year. Besides his studying, he is working a part-time job as a waiter in one of the restaurants beside his university. 

He needs the loan to help him pay for a part of his semester fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for a part of his semester fees

loans.name: Rezk

texts.en: Rezk, 33 years old, is married to a housewife and has 3 children. He operates lighting projects for wedding parties. Rezk is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy new laser lighting units and new lamps to attract more customers and to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy new laser lighting units and new lamps.

loans.name: Asem

texts.en:
Asem is a 20-year-old university student majoring in political science, and he is in his second year. He is seeking to work in his study field after graduating to be able to depend on himself. 

He is now applying for this education loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees, which he didn’t have enough money to pay because of the financial problems his family has been facing.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kugawa Village. Christiana joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. 

In the past, Christiana suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to pay her children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Christiana will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Christiana now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farm’s yields

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 25 years old and lives in Baqaa with his wife and one child.

Mohammad wants the best for his sibling Hasan; he is the younger one of his siblings, and he wants to see him be a successful man in the future. Mohammad's father is retired with a very low income; therefore, he decided to help his brother Hasan to complete his education anyway. But his income is not enough to cover his household expenses and the educational expenses for his brother, so he applied for an education loan to help his brother cover his semester fees and complete his education to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to cover his brother's semester fees

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Penninah is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kugawa Kwalbatti Village. Penninah joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Penninah will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Penninah now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to build a better home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farm’s yields

loans.name: Ma Ngay Ka Lay Group-3 Village

texts.en:
The Featured Borrower, Aye is 35 years old, married, and supports a family of five (three children). The oldest two children are in 7th and 2nd grades. He is a hardworking man and has 10 years experience in paddy farming.

Like many farmers in this area, his savings are low before the harvest season. With this loan from Proximity Designs, he no longer has to borrow from a local lender with much higher interest rates. The loan will help him purchase the necessary farming inputs such as fertilizers and gas for farming machines. These inputs are vital for his crop farming to have an increased yield.

His main aim is to educate all his children and he would like them to become doctors.

Ma Ngay Ka Lay village is located in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and has over 440 households 440. Pictured above (from left to right) are Thant, Zaw, Than, Than H and Kyaw. The CBO leaders oversee the group of 30. The fund will help the group members purchase farming essentials before harvest time. Ma Ngay Ka Lay group-3 Village’s mainly focus on crop farming, as well as other seasonal plantations such as coconuts, betel leaves and banana trees for additional income.

loans.use: rent farm equipment, purchase petrol for farm equipment, and hire farm staff during harvest time.

borrowers.first_name: Ma Ngay Ka Lay Group-3 Village

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosalia Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Rosalía” está conformada por 06 socios responsables. Este es el caso de milagros de 39 años de edad, conviviente con 03 hijos dos de ellos dependientes. Milagros es una madre empeñosa que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trata de sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente se dedica  a la venta de muebles del hogar, Se siente feliz pues incrementaron sus clientes y su negocio va mejorando cada día. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de más sillas, mesas y roperos. El deseo de milagros es ir mejorando su negocio. El grupo “Rosalía” agradece a los inversionistas de Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Milagros se encuentra parada en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo color rosado.
texts.en:
The "Rosalia" communal bank is made up of 6 responsible members. This is the case of Milagros, who is 39 years old and lives with her 3 children, two of which are dependent.

Milagros is a hard-working mother who deploys much effort and dedication to support her family. Her current job is selling household furniture, and she is happy because her clients have increased and her business is getting better with every day.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy more chairs, tables, and wardrobes. Milagros' dream is to improve her business. 

The "Rosalía" group wants to thank Kiva investors for the help they provide. Milagros is standing in the back; She is second from the left and is wearing a pink t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy more chairs, tables, and wardrobes.

loans.name: Edith Noemy

texts.es: Edith de 32 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, ella posee una tienda y también vende tortillas posee 8 años y su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construirla, pero no posee de suficiente capital, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción necesarios y el pago de mano de obra para que pueda tener una casa digna.
texts.en: Edith is 32 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She has had  a store and she also has sold tortillas for eight years. Her business is located in her home. With her earnings, she is able to push forward. She wants to improve her home by finishing the building. However, she does not have enough money. This is the reason she is requesting a loan in order to purchase needed construction materials and pay for labor.She will be able to have a respectable house.

loans.use: purchase needed construction materials and pay for labor

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Don Gilberto de 68 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 25 años, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene es como logra salir adelante, el  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, semillas e insecticida  y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Gilberto is 68 years old, he lives in his own house with his wife. He has grown corn and sorghum for twenty-five years, and sells his crops throughout the surrounding area, supporting himself on his earnings. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, pest control, seeds and insecticides to improve the land shown in the photo, so he can continue growing his crops and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, pest control, seeds and insecticide to improve the land

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 45 years old, married to Florence, and supports five children. 

He has been operating in his bookstore shop for the last seven years, earning KES 12,000 per month.
 
Evans has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of books and papers for sale to gain more income. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction. 

His future hopes and dreams include being financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of books and papers for sale to gain more income

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo es un hombre de 50 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 5 y 20 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Ricardo para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 20 años, esta labor le ha permitido progresar con su amada familia.
Ricardo con el afán de ver a sus hijos ser grandes profesionales y estar al servicio de su pueblo  ahora solicita un préstamo para poder comprarle a su hija que este año se gradúa de perito contador su uniforme de promoción, pues el en este momento no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder cubrir esta necesidad emergente.
El gran sueño de Ricardo es que todos sus hijos se gradúen para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a 50-year-old man. He is married and has a beautiful family with six children between the ages of 5 and 20. This modest family lives in the community of Sololá.

Ricardo has been working as a bricklayer for the last 20 years in order to earn the income needed to support the family he loves so much.  

Ricardo is eager to see his children become professionals and serve the community. Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy his daughter her class uniform. She will graduate this year as a qualified accountant, and at the moment he does not have the money to meet this immediate need. 

Ricardo's biggest dream is to see all his children graduate so they can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy his daughter her graduation uniform.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old, single man living in Irbid. He is studying to get his bachelor degree in computer and communication engineering, and he is now in his third year. 

Besides getting his education, he is working as a wall painter because of the financial difficulties that his family has been facing. The difficult finances lead Mohammad to apply for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees.  

Mohammad is planning to work in the same field with good income so he will help his family with household expenses

loans.use: to cover his semester fees

loans.name: Melanis Esther

texts.es: Melanis de 27 años, reside con su hijo en una vivienda ubicada en el Municipio de Soledad, ella  cuenta con una capacidad de generar ideas novedosas y  un entusiasmo con el que ha sido capaz de sacar adelante su negocio de comercialización de calzado.  En su rol de madre cabeza de familia ha tenido desafíos que afrontar al contar con un escaso capital de trabajo, sin embargo aprovechó su potencial para socializarse e inició ofreciéndoles calzado para dama a sus amigas y vecinas del sector donde reside, quienes quedaron encantadas con los diseños y su buen gusto. Ella está solicitando a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo su primer credikiva, recursos que planea invertir en un mayor volumen de calzado para atender la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.  Su meta a futuro es adquirir un local comercial y generar empleo, así mismo lograr una estabilidad económica para contar con los recursos suficientes para educar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Melanis is 27 years old and resides with her son in a house located in the Municipality of Soledad. She has the capacity to generate new ideas and an enthusiasm with which she has been capable of advancing her shoe selling business.

In her role as mother and head of the family she has had challenges to confront such as a scarcity of working capital. Nevertheless, Melanis has taken advantage of her potential to fit in, offering shoes for ladies to her friends and neighbors in the sector where she lives. They continue to be enchanted with the designs and her good taste.

Melanis is requesting her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She plans to invest these funds in the purchase of a larger volume of shoes to fulfill customer demand and improve her income.

Melanis' goal for the future is to acquire a commercial location and to generate employment, plus to achieve economic stability and to count on sufficient resources to educate her son.

loans.use: invest in a larger volume of shoes to meet customer demand and improve her income.

loans.name: Hosny

texts.en:
Hosny is 33 years old, married to a housewife, and has three children. He is a part-time laborer and also has a small grocery store project that he runs in his house. 

Hosny is requesting a 3,000 EGP loan to buy a refrigerator, some juices and fizzy drinks to generate more income for his family and cover his sister's marriage expenses.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, some juices and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 45 years old, married to Zachary, and supports a family of five children. 

She has been practicing farming for the last 15 years, earning KES 3,000 per month. 

Jane has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to supply milk for the family and for sale to gain more income. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to expand her business in the area. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and have educated children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply milk for the family and for sale to gain more income.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 27 años de edad es casado tiene una familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 1 y 5 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Jose para sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la agricultura sembrando una variedad de verduras como papa, cebolla, zanahoria, esta labor lo realiza el desde hace seis años.
Jose ahora necesita de un préstamo para poder comprar sus abonos químicos y orgánicos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo, pues él desde hace algún tiempo ha sembrado sus hortalizas que necesita ya de su mantenimiento, Jose tiene las esperanzas de contar con el crédito para poder comprar sus abonos y obtener una buena cosecha.
Jose sueña con poder construir una casa más grande para una mejor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is twenty-seven, married with two children ages one and five. This humble family lives in a community in Solola. 
To support his family, Jose grows a variety of crops such as potatoes, onions, and carrots. He has been doing this work for six years. 
Now Jose needs a loan in order to purchase organic and chemical fertilizers to tend to his crops, which he planted a while ago and now require his maintenance. Jose hopes he can count on the loan so he can buy his fertilizers and get a good harvest. 
Jose dreams of one day building a bigger house, so his family can be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es: Doña Silvia de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo posee 15 años de experiencia e inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa,  ella  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, semillas e insecticida y así continuar con su trabajo para tener una buena cosecha y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Silvia is 50 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. She grows corn and sorghum. She has 15 years of experience and started with her own capital. She sells her products at different markets near her house. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, seeds, and insecticides. She will be able to continue working,  have a good harvest and earn better profits.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, herbicides, seeds, and insecticides

loans.name: Nhóm 07 - Chicken In Town Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hạnh is 30 years old and is married.  She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry for 5 years and she has just opened a tailoring service to improve her income.  Hạnh lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in a village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
  
She is a reputable person in the community and this is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  All members in "Nhóm 07 - Chicken in town" solidarity group agreed to vote her to be the group leader.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 56 years old, a widow with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Nelly has a food stall business in the Philippines. Nelly requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more snack food to sell to customers.

Nelly has been in this business for three years. In the future, Nelly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack food to sell to customers.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Mrs. Linh is 56 years old, she is a hardworking woman and lives with her children. The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. 

Her  family has a wood shop and is the main income source of her family, so she is able to pay the loan monthly .

loans.use: To build a new latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Francisco Lucio

texts.es:
Francisco Lucio tiene 30 años de edad,conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Ël se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 03 años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo, con esto Francisco Lucio espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco Lucio is 30 years old. He lives with his partner and son in the Oyotún district. This district is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. Life in this community is peaceful. The residents are primarily involved in business and raising small livestock.

Francisco Lucio offers a transportation service with his vehicle (motorcycle taxi). He has had this business for more than three years. He has experience in this field with good personal and work references in the area. The loan will be used for repairs and maintenance on his vehicle. Francisco Lucio hopes to be able to offer a better service to his customers which will generate greater earnings. This will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: repair and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela is 64 years old and married with 10 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes and ice cake in her community and has been doing this for 4 years. 

Sela has requested a loan to buy cooking oil, flour, sugar, shopping bags,etc. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sela  will save her profit to support her family financially and for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, flour, yeast, shopping bags,

loans.name: Primero De Agosto  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
En el Cantón Montecristi es conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional, se reúne cada quince días Grupo de Crédito Primero de Agosto, este es un grupo de  12 mujeres que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Grupo el mismo que les ayudado mucho ya que con los créditos  han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios y su calidad de vida. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora señora Ramona, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, una hija vive con ellos. Su esposo es chofer y hace fletes en una camioneta de su propiedad.
Doña Ramona es una muy buena esposa hace lo posible para ganar sus propios recursos y para ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, compra pollos en  una granja de la localidad y luego los lleva hasta su casa donde los faena y vende a sus clientes  ya sea enteros o por libras, trabaja todos los días, cuenta con muy buena clientela ya que ella les entrega limpios los pollos y al peso y precio adecuado, son mas d 5 años que lleva con esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse la vida y ayudarle a su marido que a veces no gana mucho en sus fletes .
Este crédito es para comprar pollos para la venta de la semana. Lleva dos ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios que les ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The Montecristi canton is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its craftwork is recognized on a national and international level.  Every two weeks, the Primero de Agosto credit group meets there.  The group is made up of 12 women who decided to unite and form this group, which has helped them improve their small businesses and quality of life with loans.  They work doing different activities including sales, services, selling food, and others.  

One of the members of the group is Ramona, who is 54 years old, married, and has five adult children, one of whom lives with her.  Her husband is a driver and makes deliveries in a truck he owns.

Ramona is a good wife who does everything she can to earn her own income to help with the household expenses.  She works in sales.  She buys chickens from a local farm and brings them back to her home to slaughter and sell to her customers, either whole or in pieces.  She works every day and has a good customer base since she cleans the chickens and weighs and prices them well.  She has done this work for more than five years.  It allows her to earn a living and help her husband, who sometimes does not make much from his deliveries. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase chickens for weekly sales.  She has participated in two loan cycles with the credit group and she likes the services that the institution offers.  Her dream is for herself and her family to have good health.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for chilling soft drinks as preferred by most of his customers.

loans.name: Margo

texts.en:
Margo heads up for the next cropping season. He wants to prepare well especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. 

He wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer of which he applied a loan from the Cooperative. Margo hopes to save enough for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng and wife (both in the picture standing in-front of their house), are farmers with 5 children and live in Peam Chhkouk village that is far from the power grid. Beside farming, Sokheng owns a feeding and rice milling farm. As a farmer and also businessman, he wants to expand his business with 3 hectares of land and having his family live in a more comfortable condition. 

However, he is facing some problems related to home energy. His house has no reliable energy source. He has to go to charge a car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometime because of busyness, he doesn’t have time to charge battery, his business activity needs to stop and the whole family is in pitch black conditions for the whole day. 

He is applying for a Kiva loan to buy high quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition would be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar electricity home system

location.town: Peam Chhkouk Village, Peam Chhkouk Commune, Chhulk

loans.name: Jesca’S Group

texts.en:
Jesca (First the left) is a woman aged 35, married with 4 children and a resident of Nyabubale parish, Kibuga village. She is a farmer and mainly grows beans, maize, ground nuts and Irish potatoes. She also rears chicken and goats. Jesca earns her income from sale of her farm produces and animal products.
 
Jesca has been attending YICE’s programs for the last 14 months. She mobilized a group of other four farmers establish a demonstration garden in her village. Having learned a lot about good farming practices, Jesca’s group seek to apply this knowledge into their own gardens. They are requesting for a loan to pay casual laborers and buy farming tools, so as to expand their gardens. 

Jesca’s dream for future is to attain education in vegetable growing and establish a greenhouse for vegetables. She plans to use her income to attend training in vegetable growing.

loans.use: to pay casual laborers and buy farming tools so as to expand their gardens.

loans.name: Pelucy’S Group

texts.en:
Pelucy (first from the left) is aged 39, widowed with 4 children living in Nyabubale   Village, Kasese district. Pelucy maninly grows coffee, maize, banana and beans. She also has goats and a cow. After the death of her husband, Pelucy realized that she had to work hard so as to look after her family.

She joined YICE to learn more about farming and now leads a group of other four farmers that attained YICE’s practical trainings in farming as business. Pelucy and her group members are requesting for a small loan to buy good quality fertilizers, farm inputs and pay for local laborers to expand their gardens.

Pelucy’s dream is to educate all her children up to university and ensure that they live a good life.

loans.use: to buy good quality fertilizers, farm inputs and pay for local laborers to expand their gardens.

loans.name: Nurkul

texts.ru: Нуркул, 58 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Нуркул среднее образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается торговлей продуктами питания в собственном магазине, стартовав 7 лет назад, благодаря упорному труду Нуркул, в обороте есть товар на сумму 500,000 сом (KGS), ежемесячная прибыль составляет 28,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нуркул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товара для расширения ассортимента. Доходы от кредита Нуркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее дела и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Nurkul is 58, married, and a mother of four. She has a secondary education and sells grocery products in her own store to earn additional income for her family. She started her business seven years ago. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has 500,000 som (KGS) in inventory and earns 28,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to develop her business, Nurkul applied for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy grocery products to increase the variety of goods in her shop. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in the future development of her business and to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy grocery products in order to increase turnover in her shop

loans.name: Alicia Aracely

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La 24 se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Alicia,  tiene 45 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 19 y 15 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en un centro turístico.
Doña Alicia es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así ganar lo suyo por el bien de su familia, ella se dedica al comercio, vende pescado por libras o al por mayor, ella se desplaza hasta las playas de la localidad lugar en el cual compra a muy buen precio y luego lleva a su casa en la cual entrega al por mayor o por libras, ella  también recorre la ciudad vendiendo por libras ya que así le dejan más ganancias, lleva más de 3  años en esta actividad la cual le da sus propios recursos. 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado para la venta. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
The credit group La 24 meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round and for being a city with unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.  

Alicia, who is 45 years old, married, and has two children who are 19 and 15 years old and attend high school, lives in Manta.  Her husband works at a tourism center.  

Alicia is a woman who wants to earn herself for the good of her family.  She works selling fish by the pound or at wholesale.  She goes to the local beaches to purchase at a good price and later brings it to her house where she offers it at wholesale or by the pound.  She also travels the city selling by the pound, since she earns more money this way.  She has done this work for more than three years and it gives her her own resources.

She is requesting this loan to purchase fish to sell.  She has participated in three loan cycles with the credit group and she likes that the loans help her get ahead.  Her dream is that her children get the best education possible and are good people.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Mafutaga

texts.en:
Mafutaga is 29 years old and single woman with 1 child . She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. 

Mafutaga has requested a loan to buy yeast,cooking oil,flour,sugar and shopping bags. She joined SPBD in May this year 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mafutaga will use it to support her family financially and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy yeast, shopping bags, sugar, oil, flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter`s second year university fees in psychological counceling

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal is 26 year old, married and father of two children.  Vusal  works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. He has been involved in this business for more than 7  years. His wife is helping him in this business but their monthly income is not enough to cover family needs. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concern him is not having a bathroom. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a bathroom.

Vusal  hopes for his family to be healthy and happy and to maintain a successful business

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: Hector de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol y también trabaja de jornal en una finca cerca de su casa, posee 25 años de experiencia e inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, ella  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumo agrícolas como fertilizantes, herbicidas, semillas, abonos, controles de plagas, entre otros insumos y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Hector is 47 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and their four children. He grows corn and beans. He also works as a day laborer at a farm near her house. He has 25 years of experience and started with his own capital. He sells his products at different markets near his house. He is requesting a loan to purchase farming supplies like fertilizers, herbicides, seeds and other items in order to obtain better earnings.

loans.use: purchase farming supplies like fertilizers, herbicides, seeds and other items

loans.name: Doeko

texts.fr: Doeko est une femme mariée âgée de 34 ans et mère de trois enfants. Doeko vit à Agoè pour entreprendre son activité. Doeko vend des produits d’alimentations générales et des boissons dans une boutique pour gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Doeko s’approvisionne douze fois par mois au marché. Doeko demande ce crédit pour commander des boissons afin de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Doeko is a 34-year-old married mother to three children. She lives in Agoe in order to run her business. Doeko sells general foodstuffs and drinks from her stall in order to earn a living and support her family. She gets her supplies 12 times per month from market.  Doeko is requesting this loan to purchase drinks so she can earn enough profits to support her husband with their family's expenses. These profits will also be used to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase eight crates of drinks

loans.name: Alexy Ricardo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La 24 se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive el señor Alexi, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de los padres. El lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha podido mejorar su negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Don Alexi es  un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta esforzarse para ir mejorando su vida, el tiene una pequeña recicladora, compra todo tipo de materiales como plásticos, cartón, metales, cobre y muchos productos que se puedan reutilizar, contrata un camión para llevar todo lo que el recolecta en su local a Guayaquil lugar en el cual le pagan a él a muy buen precio  y así obtiene muy buenas ganancias por esta labor, lleva 3 años con esta labor con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar cartones, hierro, latas, botellas y todo tipo de material reciclable. Sus sueños son comprar un camión para no pagar fletes.
texts.en:
The credit group La 24 meets every two weeks in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round and for being a city with unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Alexi, who is 20 years old, single, and lives in his parent's home, lives in Manta.  He has participated in two loan cycles with the credit group and likes it because he has been able to improve his business and move forward thanks to the loans.

Alexi is a hardworking man who likes to make an effort to improve his life.  He has a small recycling business that purchases all types of materials like plastics, cardboard, metals, copper, and other products that can be reused.  He hires a truck to bring everything he collects in his town to a Guayaquil location where they pay him a good price.  He earns good profits from his work and has done this work for three years.

He will use this loan to purchase cardboard, iron, cans, bottles, and all types of recyclable materials.  His dream is to buy a truck so he does not have to pay shipping costs.

loans.use: to purchase cardboard, iron, cans, bottles, and all types of recyclable material.

loans.name: Ma Ngay Ka Lay Village Group-1

texts.en:
This loan will help a total of 32 group members. Tin, the featured borrower, is 56 years old, married and supports a family of seven (five children). Two of the children help in the fields to support the family income. Like many farmers in this area, savings are low before the harvest season. 

This loan will help him purchase the necessary farming inputs, such as fertilizers and gas for farming machines. These inputs are vital for his crop farming to increase yield. He also aims to purchase more land for two of his unmarried sons. For good deeds, Tin mostly donates at monasteries.

Pictured above (from left to right) are Hla, Khin, Kyaw and Tin. The CBO leaders oversee the group of 32. The fund will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time. 

Ma Ngay Ka Lay Village mainly focuses on crop farming, as well as other seasonal plantation such as coconuts, betel leaves and banana trees, for additional income.

loans.use: To rent farming equipment, purchase gas for farm equipment and hire extra farm staff during harvest time.

borrowers.first_name: Ma Ngay Ka Lay Village Group-1

loans.name: Layla Groupe

texts.en:
Ragheda is the featured borrower for Layla Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Ragheda is a 38-year-old married mother of two children. Eight years ago she started working a teacher to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their beloved children. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying hard to improve her family's living conditions. 

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house furniture in order to provide her children with a healthier place. Ragheda is the first lady on the right. 

With respect to the other group members, Layla is the lady sitting in the middle, and Maria is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to renovate her house furniture

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim is 34 years old, married, and the father of two children. He earns a living by working as a baker, making sweets in a small café. He has been doing this for the last eight years, and is his family's only breadwinner because his parents are very old and retired. His salary is 80 AZN per month, but this isn’t enough to meet family expenses. Nazim has requested this loan for 403 AZN because his daughter has a serious illness and, as we know, medical expenses are high and drugs are expensive.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, rebar, and cement to build a new wall in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing, so as to get better produce for family use.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Thôn 03 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dung is 38 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Dung lives in Quang Xuong district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
 
The main hardship that Dung faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Dung joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Dung has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to have more milk to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luisa is 51 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Luisa has a selling charcoal business in the Philippines. Luisa requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like sacks, coconut shells, etc. for her business.

Luisa has been in this business for 5 years. Luisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like sacks, coconut shells, etc. for her business

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine lives in Norashen village with her husband and 26-year-old daughter. She has been involved in farming for the last seven years, and despite difficulties was able to create a successful farm that produces beautiful fruit. Narine's husband and daughter try to help her around their farm, where she has apricot, apple, peach, plum, and walnut trees. To buy fertilizer and organic pesticides for her orchard, Narine decided to apply for this loan, her first, in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. This first-chance program provides loans to people who didn't have access to traditional credit products because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Narine get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a 49 years old woman who is single with 1 child. She plans to start a small business, selling elei in her community. 

Loreta needs a loan to buy materials, a sewing machine, scissors, thread and needles. She will use her profits to extend her business and to support her family financially.  Loreta joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials,colour paint,scissor,sewing machine,etc

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene (first from the left) is a female aged 31, married with three children, living in Kivengenyi village, Kasese district. Irene is a smallholder farmer and she grows beans, cassava, maize and banana. She also rears chickens and goats, from which she earns a living. 

Irene is leads group of five farmers in her village. These farmers have attained training on better maize and bean farming. As a result of the knowledge learned, group members have started teaching other fellow farmers on modern farming technology.  Their plan is to transfer the knowledge and skills learned from YICE to all their neighbors in the community.

They are therefore requesting for a small loan so as to buy good quality maize/bean seeds, manure and attain more knowledge to improve their gardens. They believe this would help them double their productivity and incomes.

Irene’s dream is to become a leading female farmer in her community training other farmers in modern farming techniques.

loans.use: to buy good quality maize/bean seeds, manure and attain training on farming

loans.name: Farrah

texts.en:
Farrah is 48 years old with 2 children all in school.

Her husband is working abroad as a sales man.

She operates a wholesaler-retail vehicle spare parts store. She learned this business from her former job as a sales lady in a spare parts store. Because her salary and her husband salary abroad is not enough for the schooling of her children, she decided to put up a retail vehicle spare parts business from the money she saves for her children education.  Her strategy of giving much lower prices earns her more customers. And through hard work and good management Farrah store become a retail-wholesale store.  

Most of the challenges Farrah face is the lack of capital to supply the demand of her customers. She wanted to grab the opportunity of increasing her income to provide for her family.

Farrah is now requesting a loan amounting to PhP 50,000 to buy vehicle spare parts and accessories such as lights, side mirrors, brakes, suspensions, seat belts and tires and road wheels in bulk. 

Farrah is confident that through this loan she will have a chance to increase her income and in expand her business to saves for the future of her children.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts and accessories such as lights, side mirrors, brakes, suspensions, seat belts and tires and road wheels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing the crops on his farm so as to get better produce for family use.

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik and her husband have been involved in farming for over 16 years. They keep on the farm livestock of nine cows, calves, twenty five sheep and hens. On their own land they also cultivate barley and sell it in bulk.  Nazik and her husband help each other around their farm, and that's the reason they own beautiful and successful farm.
 
In order to pay for cultivation works, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock, Nazik has applied for this loan. 

As this is Nazik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative almost 500 borrowers like Nazik get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. 

This is Nazik's first loan with Kiva lenders, and she expects good results.

loans.use: to pay for cultivation works, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Sokhim runs a grocery shop with her husband and she has a child . Her husband is a teacher in a school near by while Sokhim stays in the grocery shop to run the business and takes care of her only child. Getting product prepared before sun raise is her daily activity. 

Therefore, she needs energy to generate light for long time usage. Currently, they use a car battery to substance their business energy; however, a car battery is not reliable. It has short life span and is easily damaged. Sometime the car battery is runs out during the night time. After getting good recommendation from neighbor that uses solar home systems, Sokhim decided to apply for Kiva loan to buy a solar home systems. She believes this decision will improve her energy to run business and also save utility fee.

loans.use: to pay for solar electricity home system

location.town: Prey Gneam Village, Svay Chork Commue, Samaki Mean

loans.name: Ta Mut Village

texts.en:
The featured forrower, San, is 51 years old, married, and supports a family of five (three children). San is a hardworking woman; she plants paddies and bananas, and coconuts as well. Farming has been done through generations, so it runs in her blood.

For the past three years, she has been facing the effects of “Twain snail”, a kind of insect that eats paddies on the farm. The loan will help her purchase the necessary farming inputs such as fertilizers and gas for farm equipment. She will also use the funds to hire laborers who will help her to remove those snails. Therefore, this loan is necessary to invest in San's farm to increase yield.

She plans to open big grocery shops for all the villagers to access with all the stock in the future. To have good deeds, San mostly gives donations in the village monastery.

Pictured above (from left to right) are Hla, Myint, Thaung, and San. The CBO leaders oversee the group of 15. The fund will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time. Ta Mut Village’s main focus is crop farming, as well as other seasonal plantations, such as coconut and banana trees, for additional income.

loans.use: to rent farm equipment, purchase petrol for farm equipment, and hire farm staff during harvest time.

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
Eligio está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad y auditoria, vive con su hermana y su mama, comenta que su meta es poder aplicar los conocimientos que ha adquirido en sus estudios a su propia empresa.
Quiere ser un profesional útil la sociedad y a las demás personas es por ello que se está esforzando mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de los útiles para su universidad y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Eligio is studying accounting and auditing. He lives with his sister and mother. He says that his goal is to apply the knowledge he acquired in his studies to his own enterprise. 

He wants to become a professional who is useful to society and other people, which is why he is making a big effort. He is asking for this loan in order to pay for university supplies and continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay for university supplies.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 28 years old, married to Hyline, and supports a family of one child.

He has been practicing poultry farming for the last four years, earning KES 14,000 per month.

Peterson has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy poultry feed for high production and supply, so as to earn more income.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction.

His future hopes and dreams are to financially stable.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed for high production and supply, so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La 24 se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Mayra, tiene 34 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta  relación tiene tres hijos de 15, 14 y 7 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es albañil. Hace varios años ella aprendió belleza en una Academia artesanal en la ciudad
Doña Mayra es una mujer muy trabajadora que hace lo posible para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, hace mas de 13 años instaló en su casa un salón de belleza, allí ella realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabello, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas, ella también vende ropa de todos tipo lo cual lo hace en su salón o también sale a vender en sus días menos ocupados. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar esmaltes, tintes y ropa. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta el trato de la promotora y los beneficios que recibe de la fundación. Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The “La 24” credit group meets every two weeks in Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches, which have many visitors in every season of the year.  It is also known for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Mayra lives in this place.  She is 34 years old and is in a common-law relationship.  From this relationship she has three children, ages 7, 14, and 15.  The two older ones are in high school and the youngest is in school.  Her partner is a construction worker.  A number of years ago she studied cosmetology in an artisan school in the city.

Mayra is a very hardworking woman who does everything she can to earn an income.  With this she helps her partner with the household expenses and the children’s schooling.  Thirteen years ago she installed a beauty salon in her house.  There she offers a variety of treatments such as dye jobs, haircuts, and manicures, among others.  She also sells every type of clothing out of her salon, and she goes out to sell clothing as a mobile vendor on her less busy days.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 8 p.m. and sometimes even later if her customers need her services.

She is going to use this loan to buy nail polish, dyes, and clothing.  She has been in the credit group from the beginning and she likes the marketing and benefits that she gets from the organization.  Her dream is to have a big shop.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, dyes, and clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting in his already prepared farm so as to get a better harvest for family use and sale to clientst.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is a 56 year-old woman from the region of Soroca. She is married, has five children and works in agriculture, specifically with the cultivation of apples, raspberries and strawberries. She started the business 15 years ago, and it is now the core business of the family. At the moment, the family cultivates 11 hectares, two hectares is private property, three hectares are owned by her son and the other six hectares are rented from local people. They are growing plums, summer and autumn apples. They also grow raspberries and strawberries on a 40 acre plot of land.  

During the year, almost all agricultural work is carried out by family members, but when the time demands more manpower, they hire seasonal workers. To help with the agricultural work, the family uses outdated technology and a Soviet-era tractor. The lack of modern equipment has an effect on the overall quality of the finished goods and frequency repairs impacts the timeliness in which the work can be done. 

It is Galina’s goal to buy the newest equipment for their agricultural business, which will enable her to produce a better quality product and increase production. The new equipment will enable Galina and her family to increase revenue for the business and create a more sustainable source of income.

loans.use: To pay for new agricultural equipment like a tractor, to replace outdated Soviet-era machinery

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 25 years old and single. 

Juliet is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Juliet has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juliet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To lease land to expand his farming activity.

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en:
Ebenezer is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has no children. For the past two years, Ebenezer has been working hard to manage his stationary shop. 

To help expand his business, Ebenezer has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy photocopying paper, machine, books, and pens, and will help Ebenezer to generate greater profits and increase sales. Ebenezer hopes that in the future, he will be able to own one of the biggest stationary shops in town.

loans.use: to buy photocopying paper, machine, books, and pens

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan does not work and her husband works with a low income and she is blessed with two children.  One of them is Noor, who appears in the photo, instead of Hanan, because she is a conservative woman. 

Because of the financial crisis that Hanan and her husband have been faced with, she is applying for a loan and will use it to pay for her daughter Noor's tuition fees, who is studying for a bachelor of tourism management degree.

Hanan needs your help to see her daughter graduate in one day.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter Noor's tuition fees in tourism management

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 27 years, married to Lilian and he supports 2 children. 
He has been offering motorcycle transport services to clients for the last 2 years and the business earns him KES 9,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as engines, tires and windscreens so as to maintain and repair his motorcycle to enable him offer better transport services to clients
.
He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his business sector. 
His hope is to be financially stable and purchase more motorcycles for transportation services.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts such as engines, tyres and windscreens so as to maintain and repair his motorcycle to enable him offer better transport services to clients.

loans.name: Josue Group

texts.fr:
M. SAMBO est responsable du groupe  JOSUE. Marié il est père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé à 06 ans et le moins âgé a 1 an et demi. Il a 04 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l’agriculture et l’élevage depuis 21 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les marchés environnant.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il veut s’acheter 04 sacs d’engrais.
Monsieur compte épargner ses bénéfices pour pouvoir construire. Il veut aussi s’occuper des études de ses enfants.
texts.en: François is in charge of the Josue group. He is married and father to two children, the elder of whom is six years old and the younger one and a half. He has four dependants. He has been farming and raising animals for the past 21 years and gets his supplies in the surrounding markets. With the money he is granted, he would like to buy four sacks of fertilizer. He plans to save his profits so he can build. He would also like to be able to provide for his children's studies.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 26, single, and lives with his mother. He has a small cattle-fattening project.

He is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to get more milk and allow his mother and sister to make more cheese and butter for domestic use and for sale in the local market.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Ta Mawt Ka Lay Village

texts.en:
The Featured Borrower, Hla is 57 years old, married and has three children. She farms in her eight acres of crop farm and has many years of experience in this business. Proximity’s loan will have a lot of good impacts in Hla’s business that also includes regulations in cash flows. Farming needs to have a huge capital before harvest season. 

This loan will also help Hla, purchase the necessary farming inputs such as fertilizers and petrol for farm equipment. These inputs are vital for her crop farming to increase yields. The profits from the loan, will be used to plant over hundred of lime trees. She is a member in local health care organization for mother and child care which is to educate, living healthily.

Ta Mot Ka Lay village is located in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and has households of over 50. Pictured above (from left to right) are Hla, Kyaw, Aung, Aye and Nay. The CBO leaders oversee the group of 22 members. 

The fund will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time. Ta Mot Ka Lay Village mainly focus on crop farming, as well as other seasonal plantation such as lime, coconut and banana trees, for additional income.

loans.use: to help the 22 member group purchase farming equipment and fertilizers

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 34-year resident of Mpawu, Kyotera in the Rakai district, married with 4 children who all attend school.

She carries out a business of farming, where she grows coffee, which she started in 2006. She is also a qualified nurse, from which she earns supplementary income. She works 6 days of the week and 12 hours per day and she started farming with the aim of boosting her daily income. She wants a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to pay school fees for her children.

Her clients are people from different towns, and other coffee traders. However, her challenges are lack of enough capital to improve her garden and make it profitable, in addition to competition so as to acquire enough money to pay school fees.

Florence is a focused, hardworking lady who wants to always have her children in good schools to acquire knowledge..

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Fotoh Mirabel

texts.en:
Mirabel is married and has two children. The family lives in a one bedroom house in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate finances to start up a business of her own and to cater for her family's needs, which include sickness, the death of her son and her father, who was of great help to her, and her husband's accident that ended up with his one leg cut off. 

With this new loan requested, Mirabel will buy more of her business articles, such as bread, plantains, pure water (tangui), and sweet drinks, and she will also add SIM card retail to her business. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for about three years and has regular customers who buy from her. 

With this business activity, the community will benefit because Mirabel sells her products at moderate prices, and the distance to buy from the market will be reduced. Concerning the profit made from this loan, Mirabel will expand her business, ensure her children's education, provide medication when needs arise and save some for a bigger investment. She prefers the GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy plantains, pure water, sweet drinks, and SIM cards for retail

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a repeat client at Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MD), having taken before 14 loans from Ugafode. She is a resident of Masajja B zone Makindye Kampala. She is a married woman.

She is a businesswoman, having a poultry farm and rental units as her major sources of income for the family.	

She has applied for the loan of UGX 2,100,000 to pay school fees for her daughter and son who are in secondary school levels, however she has been one of Ugafode's long time clients and among the best loan repayers. 	

Agnes cannot appreciate Ugafode enough for the support that has been continously been advanced to her.

She is very great full for the support Ugafode has given to her .

loans.use: To pay tuition for her children

loans.name: Larissa

texts.es:
La Srta. Larissa, es estudiante de la carrera Psicología desea terminar su carrera para poder tener un futuro mejor, y por medio de sus conocimientos poder abrirse camino en el mundo profesional.
Quiere poder ayudar también a su familia que siempre la han apoyado en todo lo que ella ha necesitado.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir luchando y estudiando
texts.en:
Larissa is a psychology student. She wishes to finish her degree in order to have a better future, and through her knowledge to earn her way in the professional world.

She wants to help her family as well, who have supported her in everything she has needed. She requests this loan in order to pay her tuition fees and so to keep moving on and studying.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a shade for his shoe shine services so as to attract more customers and to earn more income.

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is 48 years old single man, from the village of Chervalidzeebi. He is very poor, who only has income from his age pension. Khvicha and his mother live alone and it's very hard for them to satisfy even basic needs. Khvicha sometimes cultivates agricultural land and harvest beans and maize, for family-use mostly. 

In order to increase the income somehow, Khvicha decided to start dairy farming and seek for credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts was unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1500 GEL for purchasing a milk cow.  

After the cow is purchased, the family will start producing dairy products: cheese and yogurt for selling. They also use the milk products for family feeding. 
The loan will be very important financial support for this poor family, as they will get the stable source of income and tackle their financial difficulties.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow for income and thus tackle the poverty they live in

loans.name: Ma Ngay Ka Lay Village (Group-2)

texts.en:
The Featured Borrower, Zaw is 37 years old, married with one child. He has spent over half of his life in the crop farming business. Like many farmers in this area, savings are low before the harvest season. With this loan from Proximity Designs, he no longer has to borrow from a local lender with much higher interest rates. 

The loan will help him purchase the necessary farming inputs such as fertilizers and gas for farm equipment. These inputs are vital for his crop farming to increase yield. He is planning to buy more lands to expand his farming business. His dream is to maintain a successful rice farming business for future generations.

Pictured above (from left to right) are Zaw, Htain, Hla, Hla and San. The CBO leaders oversee the group of 30. The fund will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time. Ma Ngay Ka Lay (group-2) Village’s main focus is crop farming, as well as other seasonal plantation such as coconut trees, betel trees and banana trees, for additional income.

loans.use: To rent farm equipment, purchase petrol for farm equipment and hire farm staff during harvest time.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah (First from the left) is a woman aged 34, married with five children and a resident of Kivengenyi village Kivengenyi parish. She leads a group of five farmers in her village. She is a farmer who majorly grows sweet potatoes, maize, cassava, and soy beans. She also rears goats, chickens and has a pig. She earns her income through sale of crop produces. 

Having suffered low yields from their crops for a long time, Sarah and her group members joined YICE’s farming as business program to learn more on how they can improve their productivity. They have attended several trainings and have gained practical knowledge and skills on better farming. They are therefore requesting for the loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides and improved seedling in order to boost their productivity the coming farm season. 

Sarah’s dream is to become main supplier of food stuffs to people in her community and hopes to use this loan to achieve her goal. With an increased income, Sarah will buy new land to expand her garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and improved seedling in order to boost their productivity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk in the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Ramón Eduardo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito La 24 se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Ramón, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 14 y 11 años que en colegio y escuela. Su mujer es comerciante.
El señor Ramón es un hombre muy  trabajador que le gusta ir mejorando su vida a base de trabajo honrado, el se dedica al comercio,  junto a su mujer  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como granos, detergentes, carnes, legumbres, entre productos de primera necesidad, cosas de bazar, papelería, helados, entre otros, trabajan todos los días y casi todo el día, llevan más de 15 años con este negocio con el cual cada vez mejoran mas su vida.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar víveres y artículos de bazar y papelería.  Lleva 4 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "La 24" meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city that is known for its excellent beaches, which are very popular at all times of the year, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.

In this place lives Ramón, who is 37 years old. He is in a common-law relationship, and he has two children, who are 14 and 11 years old and attend school. His wife is a merchant. 

Ramón is a very hard-working man; he enjoys improving his life through honest work. He makes a living as a merchant. He and his wife have a grocery store in their home. There, they sell all kinds of products such as grains, detergents, meats, vegetables, other staple goods, stationary products, and ice creams, among other things. They work every day for most of the day. They have had this business for more than 15 years, and it allows them to continue improving their lives.

Ramón is requesting this loan to buy food supplies and stationary products. He has been a member of the communal bank for 4 years, and he likes it because the loans help him with his business. His dream is to provide the best for his children.

loans.use: to buy food supplies and stationary products.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a man of about 42 years, living with his wife and five children, four of whom are attending school.

He is a businessman with a retail shop at Kamuli, an activity he has done for 20 years and he is proud to have reaped a lot from it, including building a family residential house. In addition to his retail shop, John runs an agricultural produce business, which supplements his daily income.
 
In addition to the above mentioned businesses, John has been able to take care of his family and children. John says he is acquiring this loan to boost his retail shop and produce business, especially to add more stock in his retail shop.

John also affirms that his biggest clientele base is at home and coffee traders within the community that usually deposit money before the actual harvest of coffee is done. According to John, his biggest challenges are lack of sufficient capital and weather changes, such as droughts and floods. 

The limited capital challenge will soon be history. John appreciates UGAFODE Microfinance Limited and Kiva support.

loans.use: to boost his retail stock business.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Lori Berd village of Lori region. She lives with her husband, son, daughter in law and two grandchildren (her granddaughter is photographed with her)
. 
Anahit is a nurse by profession and is part time worker in local clinic. Anahit and her husband are ones of the many parents who have to take care of and bring up their children, by working hard and through the many problems that can emerge in an agricultural business. Currently they keep two cows, calves, pig and some hens. As a result of working night and day, Anahit manages to sell some meat, dairy products and eggs, right from the village. 

To be able to enlarge her livestock and enrich her farm, Anahit has applied for this loan. She will buy 4 oxen. As this is Anahit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative almost 500 borrowers like Anahit get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses.
This is Anahit's first loan with Kiva, and she hopes that the Kiva loan will bring success to her agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for four oxen to enlarge the livestock and gather more income for the family

location.town: Lori Berd village of Lori region

loans.name: Ziyada's Group

texts.en:
