Ziyada's group comprises two hardworking women. Ziyada is 20 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past five years, Ziyada has been working hard to manage her shoe business, which deals in shoes.

To help expand her business, Ziyada has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes, and will help Ziyada to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Ziyada hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up another branch.

Ziyada is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified seeds and farm input for use in the farm for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and dairy feeds so as to get milk to sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years and he supports 3 children. 

He has been offering motorcycle transport services in the market for the last 5 years and the business earns him KES 9,000 per month. 
He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as wind screens, tyre boosters and tyres for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle so as to offer better transport services to clients.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand his business sector. 

His hope is to be financially stable and purchase more motorcycles for transportation services.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as wind screens, tyre boosters and tyres for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle so as to offer better transport services to clients.

loans.name: Ragab

texts.en:
Ragab is 31 years old, married and has 4 children. His aging and sick parents live with him in the same house since he has to take care of them. 

Ragab has a small animal fattening project and is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to increase his sales, especially in Ramadan and the feast seasons and allow his wife to join him to the project.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 55 years old, married, and blessed with five children. He is a dairy farmer. He has been supplying milk to his customers and it has been profitable. He will be using the loan to buy a dairy cow so as to get more milk to sell and make more income to support his family. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hopes are to expand his dairy farming by buying more dairy cows, making more income, and supporting his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to get more milk to sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives with her 18-year-old daughter in Kapan town. To sustain her daughter's living, she started a retail business six years ago. Karine trades clothing and shoes supplies from her house. She was able to gather a good client base during her six years of work in the retail business. 

To purchase new clothing and shoes supplies from spring-summer collection to sell to customers, Karine has applied for this loan. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This is Karine's first deal with Kiva lenders and she hopes to have successful cooperation.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes supplies to sell to customers

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 41 years old, married to a housewife, and has six children. He has a curtains and furniture cloth sales project. He previously requested a 3,000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on its due dates. He is requesting another 5,000 EGP loan to buy new styles of cloth to increase his sales and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy new styles of cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of cereals for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more books, pens and other scholastic materials for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk in the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Teboho

texts.en:
Teboho is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is his story:
1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am studying Bachelor of Art in business Administration (BBA Degree). I enjoy Economics, business law and ethics, Sustainable living at most times and Marketing as well.

2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
My goals after graduating from MI are to be exposed in the corporate environment, working at Marketing and Advertising sector/department. I preferably like to work at Cape Town. In terms of travelling it will depend on how far I am from work place, but yes I do like to travel.

3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I am a first born at home; I was born at a place called Sharpeville, South of Joburg were Sharpeville Massacre took place at which was in 1960 March 21. From my father’s side we are 3 children, boys only. I was raised by my uncle’s mother but now I stay with my grandmother and my cousin we both depend on granny’s pension grant. My father doesn’t work and my mother works as a cashier at ShopRite and her husband does not work, she has to support her husband and my two young brothers. Am not married am still at school and I don’t have a child.

4.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
On my spare time I like to do reading and listening to music that deserved to be heard, I also like to help my grandmother with everything she needs in terms of using my hands to help her.

5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
Kiva will change my life because I will put more effort on my studies, knowing that I have to be paying the loan back, so they can help another person and because I will be receiving a monthly stipend, I will be able to use that money for transport fees, so that I am not falling behind with school work.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Hrachya

texts.en:
Hrachya is a cook from Gyumri town. He works in one of the local cafes and lives with his wife, parents and brother.  He is a hard working and talented cook, who provides cooking service for different events. 

To be able to purchase special knives for meat processing and forming, purchase containers and also a barbecue spit, Hrachya has applied for this loan. 

Hrachya has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan will significantly increase Hrachya's income, as with new tools he will be able to make his work effective and receive many orders.

loans.use: to pay for special knives for meat processing and forming, purchase containers and also a barbecue spit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials  such as chairs, tables and sauce pans for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Myres

texts.en:
Myres,is a new client with UGAFODE MICROFINANCE LTD; he is married. They have 4 children, aged between 2 and 10. Three of these children attend school. 

He is a teacher at a local primary school in kajara,he also has a banana plantation from which he sells bananas to supplement his income. 

He has applied for a loan of ugx 2,000,000 to buy farm inputs in the form of mulch and cow dung to spread on his banana plantation for increased yield leading to more sales and profit. 

He will pay the loan using proceeds from the sales. He is hard working and honest. He apprciates UGAFODE and Kiva support.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Valeri's Group

texts.en:
Valeri (first from the left) is 32 years old, married with five children, and lives in Kinyayobyo Village Kyalanga parish. Valeri is a farmer and she grows oranges, mangoes, and passion fruit, which she sells to earn a living. 

Valeri mobilized and leads a group of five fellow member farmers who actively participate in trainings organized by YICE on farming as business. As result of these trainings, group members learned that their farm output has always been low because of poor quality seeds, lack of fertilizers, and poor crop handling. The group now requests a loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and good quality seeds in order to boost their farm output. 

Valeri’s dream is to become a model farmer and inspire other community members to start farming as a source of income for their livelihoods.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and farm tools to expand their gardens

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 58-year-old married man with six children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer and at the same time gets support from her children. She faces challenges of the high cost of agriculture inputs and unpredictable weather changes. In spite of that she is working very hard to make sure she is finally stable. Margret has asked for a loan to prepare her tomato gardens and plant tomatoes.

loans.use: to prepare her tomato gardens and plant tomatoes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph used his previous loan to buy seedlings and manure for his farm. He is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Joseph still deals in coffee farming, which he started in order to improve his standard of living and to educate his children. He also earns additional income from brewing alcohol and selling produce. His main challenges are inadequate capital and price fluctuation.  He still hopes to increase his profits and construct another house.  

He is requesting a loan to buy more coffee for selling.

loans.use: to buy more coffee for selling.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is an auto repair specialist who lives in Kapan town with his wife. Their only daughter is married and lives separately with her family. 

Karen works at a local garage. He usually purchases damaged cars, renovates them and resells them at a new and profitable price. 

Karen is asking for this loan to purchase such a car and start the renovation process. The loan will substantially help him to enlarge his income and provide better living for his family. 

He has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy a damaged car, renovate it and resell it for profit

loans.name: Samy

texts.en:
Samy is married and lives with his parents in the same house, where he takes care of his sick father and of his brother who also has a physical disability. 

Samy works in painting walls and is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy new painting tools such as rollers and brushes to attract more customers and generate income for his family and afford medication for his father.

loans.use: To buy new painting tools like rollers and brushes, to help pay for medication for his father

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 52 years old and married.  She has three children. Her husband has a physical disability and is unemployed; her youngest son is a part-time laborer. 

Nadia has a small poultry project.  She is requesting a 5,000 EGP to buy geese, ducks, and chickens to generate more income for her family and to pay for her daughter's marriage preparations.

loans.use: To buy geese, ducks, and chickens.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 34 years old, married and supports 4 children. He has a call center shop and also sells phones accessories.

He will be using this loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy phone accessories such as phone chargers, batteries and phone covers for sell and make more income to support his family. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start a retail shop in the area. His future hopes and dreams are to be successful.

loans.use: To buy phone accessories such as phone chargers, batteries and phone covers for sale and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is 23 years old, married to Malivin and supports a family of two children. He has been practicing farming for the last four years earning KES. 8,500 per month. 

Kevin has applied for a loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy farm sprayers and tools for use for high production and supply for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to expand his farming practices. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm sprayers and tools for use for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Theresa. She is married and has three children, aged 26, 24, and 20 years. In 1999, Theresa established her drink-selling business.  She began her business because she wanted to become self-employed. Her business is located on the outskirts of town, and her main customers are the general community people. 

Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Theresa has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a loan in order to buy more drinks. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase her profit.   

In the future, Theresa still plans to become a wholesaler and distributor. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Tassie

texts.en:
This is 54-year-old Tassie. She is married and has three children, age 29, 23 and 19. 

In 2009, Tassie established her provisions business. She began her business because she wanted to support her family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Tassie has already received and successfully repaid her second loan and now requires a new loan to buy four cartons of Peak milk powder, six cartons of Ovaltine, three cartons of tea leaves, four cartons of salad cream, four cartons of ketchup and five cartons of sardines for resale.  

For her future goal, Tassie was not able to meet her target, but she managed to raise savings and pay fees for her children during the previous loan term and still plans to open more outlets, build more houses and send her children to the university. She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to buy four cartons of Peak milk powder, six cartons of Ovaltine, three cartons of tea leaves, four cartons of salad cream, four cartons of ketchup and five cartons of sardines for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase two dozen sets of dishes for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a twenty-eight-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She used the previous loan to buy cocoa for resale. Her business is cocoa buying and selling, a business that has seen her look after her family. She also has a cocoa garden to supplement her incomes.

Rose will use the loan to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Auk Ywar Ka Lay Village

texts.en:
The fund will help 21 village customers. The Featured Borrower, Aye is 45 years old, married, and has two children who are helping the parents in the farm. Aye is a hardworking man and has been in this business from last 5 years. 

Like many farmers in this area, Aye has to struggle a lot for savings before the harvest season. Proximity's loan will help him purchase the necessary farming inputs such as fertilizers and gases for farming machines . These inputs are vital for his crop farming to increase yield. Aye plans to boost the income by starting up a second business as planting the seasonal foods and flowers. Income from plantations will be used as investments in crop. He hopes his hard work will let him achieve the dream of purchasing paddy fields for his two children.

Auk Ywar Ka Lay village is located in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region and has households of over 60. Pictured above (from left to right) are Aye, Maung, Thant, Zaw and Win. The CBO leaders oversee the group of 21. The fund will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time.

Many households from Auk Ywar Ka Lay Village mainly focus on crop farming and as a second business, they also plant seasonal foods and flowers.

loans.use: To rent farm equipment, purchase petrol for farm equipment, and hire farm staff during harvest time

loans.name: Munyaradzi

texts.en:
Munyaradzi is a single woman, aged 31, who lives in Harare, Zimbabwe.  She is the mother of a 5-year-old boy. 

She used a previous Kiva loan to expand her fruit stall business and successfully repaid the $500 last year. 

Munyaradzi now wants to expand into a new business of poultry farming. She will use the profits to support her family, including paying school fees for her son. 

She is also keen to create employment opportunities in her local community.

loans.use: To expand into poultry farming

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg lives and works in Gyumri town of Shirak region. 
He usually buys damaged cars, renovates them and and resells them at a more profitable price in the local car bazaar. This is main activity Gevorg is involved in. He also works as a security officer in one of the local companies, as a part time worker. 

To be able to purchase a car for renovation, Gevorg has applied for this. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The income which Gevorg earns is the only one in his family, and it is hardly enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved parents. The loan is important for Gevorg and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a car to renovate and sell it at a higher price

loans.name: Andile

texts.en:
Andile is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute: This is his story:
1.	What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am studying for a Bachelor of Art, Degree IN Business and I enjoy Marketing Management class and Financial Management.

2.	What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
After graduation I would like to work in the Marketing sector, hence I have a strong point in sales, it would be best to find a job around Jo'burg as it is the ultimate city for the corporate world. In future I would like to be in foreign investment and tour around the world.

3.	Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I was born and raised in Johannesburg with two siblings before me. We were raised by both our parents with my father as a bread winner. I am not married at the moment and I do not have children but I hope I will in future.

4.	What do you like to do in your spare time?
I like to read books on my spare time; my favorite book is The Astonishing Power of a story by Justine Cohen.

5.	How will Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
The loan will make a huge impact in my life, I will be able to get to school on time in terms of transport and I will save some of the stipend that I will be earning.

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is involved in a clothing sale business in Gyumri town. She lives with her husband and three year old daughter. Her husband works as a migrant laborer in a neighbouring country. 

In order to help him with family's costs, Margarita, three years ago decided to start her own business.
She started to purchase clothing supplies from Yerevan town and sell it locally, in Gyumri town. Margarita works really hard to satisfy her customers' orders and gather income for the family's daily costs. She has now applied for this loan to purchase new clothing products to meet  current orders of her customers. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new clothing products to meet her clients' demand

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 45 years old and married to a taxi driver.  They have two beautiful children, who are 13 and 21 years old. 

For three years now, Doreen has been selling bottled water both at home and in a store she rented at Bubiashie. She also sells fried yam in her shop.

Doreen wants to expand her business, but she lacks the required capital needed to expand. With this loan, she will be able to buy more water to sell. 

She believes this will enable her to increase her income and be able to help support her family.

loans.use: To buy bottled drinkung water to sell

loans.name: Kadijatu

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Kadijatu. She is married and has three children aged 27, 19 and 10 years. She has two additional dependents, who live with her for schooling.  

In 2009, Kadijatu established her grocery business. She began her business because she wanted to develop herself and her family. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. 

Kadijatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a loan in order to buy more drinks of different kinds, milk, sardines, etc. for resale.  The living conditions of Kadiatu’s family have improved due to the profit made from the last loan.  In the future, Kadijatu still plans to build a house on her own.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of drinks for resale

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es: Jonathan, tiene la edad  de 28 años, está casado, vive con su hijo y esposa, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol que se adapte bien a las condiciones de la zona y de buena calidad y que tenga una buena geminación y la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 28 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son, who are his highest priority.

With his loan, he hopes to buy bean seeds that adapt well to local conditions and that are of good quality and have a good germination rate. He also hopes to buy fertilizers and other products to apply to the crop as well as pay for labor costs to apply these products and to tend to the crop once it grows. In this way, he can be assured of having a good crop.

Jonathan would like to take advantage of the area's good weather and soil conditions for this crop, and also to put into practice several years' experience in managing basic grains. He would also like to buy the best quality products so that his field develops well and healthily, and that he also gets a good harvest, and in the short term have good production.

He would like to use the income from the harvest that he hopes to get for the family's education and wellbeing, to fulfill some family goals, and to continue investing more in the crops.

This is the first loan that Jonathan has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans in the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him the loan with greater ease and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, fertilizers, and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en:
Kellen appreciates UGAFODE's and Kiva's support for bringing her to her current good status in the community. 

Kellen has been a customer of UGAFFODE Microfinance for 10 years now. Being a local counsellor, Kellen has helped to preach the gospel of proper loan use and the benefits of financial institutions to community members, especially the women. 

Kellen is a hardworking woman, resilient, and a community mobiliser in Biharwe, Mbarara. She is a farmer who has a banana plantation where she wants to buy manure, especially cow dung and grass, to mulch the area. 

She has promised to use her banana plantation to get money to work on her house rentals, which are her major source of income. She is earning good money, which has helped her to educate her children as a single mother and also to maintain the property that her late husband left behind.

She will use the loan of UGX 5,000,000 to buy farm inputs in form of manure, which will help to increase her harvest as well as improve her yields, income, and profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and mulch for her farm

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a seasoned farmer who lives with his wife and 7 children in Ol-joro-orok location, Kenya. He practices dairy and poultry farming to earn a living. He also relies on rain water for domestic use and for moisturizing soil on his 0.25 acre farm where he grows crops for food and feed. 

Stephen is seeking a loan to grow his poultry activity. He intends to use this loan to buy traditional breeds of chicken that are adapted to local conditions.  With your loan investment into his business, he plans to increase the heads of poultry from the current 25 to 65. He wants to take advantage of the growing demand for poultry products in the market. 

Stephen will use the income that he hopes to earn from this investment to look after his family’s well-being and their children’s education. He also wants to continue investing in poultry.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Kagorogoro Kweterana Group

texts.en:
Jackson is the man on the right hand with his hand raised in the group photo and also one of the 6 members of Kagorogoro Kweterana group. This group is located at Kiganda village, Nyakishengi subcounty, Rukungiri district.

Jackson is a businessman who buys coffee from farmers, dries it, hulls the coffee and sells clean coffee with no husks to companies that buy coffee. Apart from trading coffee, Jackson owns a bakery in Kanungu district where he bakes cakes, doughnuts and other wheat products.

Jackson faces financial challenges of limited capital to adequately run the bakery. As a result he joined Kagorogoro Kweterana group in order to apply for a loan to add capital to the bakery by buying flour, sugar and other ingredients needed for baking. This will help him to earn more income to improve the standard of living of his family.

The group is thankful for the support given by Ugafode and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.en:
Mariela is single and she lives with her aunts, where she is a farmer.  She sells milk and needs a loan to buy a milking cow, because she wants to increase her milk production.  

That way she can increase her income because she helps her aunts with the expenses.  Mariela works hard and she hopes you can help her

loans.use: to buy a milking cow to increase production

loans.name: Monrovia Group

texts.en:
Debora is in her early 40's, married and has two kids who are at school. Since 2004, she has had a business of clothes door to door selling (mtumba or second hand clothes). She starts selling from 6.am to 6.pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is her first credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy clothes for her business. Debora dreams to open a business center to avoid problems of moving door to door. She will share this loan with her group" MONROVIA GROUP" consist of five members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes for her business

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a female who is 38 years of age and married with seven children, of whom three are in school. She deals in a cassava flour business, where she invested the previous loan and receives additional income from farming. She started the business to cater for the family's needs, although she is faced with a challenge of delayed payments by her customers. She describes herself as being honest and hardworking. 

She intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets to roof her house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to roof her house.

loans.name: Abizerana Group

texts.en:
Marie Jeanne is a group leader, aged 44. She is married with 5 children aged between 3 and 18 years; all of them go to school. The group is called ABIZERANA means “Trusted” in English. 

They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She sells a clothes and has been doing business for the past 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more T-Shirts, shirts and trousers for sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more T-Shirts, shirts and trousers for sell, for house renovations and school fees

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat and his wife started a catering service two years ago. They rented a place in the center of Kapan town, where they opened their catering business. 

After their first profit started to appear, Marat and his wife decided to improve their businesst.  Marat has requested this loan to pay for wall reconstruction, buy food and beverages, and also cover transportation costs.

It is very important for Marat to receive this loan, combine it with his money, and improve his start-up. 

Marat  has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

This is his and his wife's first deal with Kiva lenders.  They hope for lenders' support and good cooperation.

loans.use: to pay for improvements, buy food and beverages, and cover transportation costs in hs catering service.

loans.name: Feri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Feri, one of Ruma's agents. Feri lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about 5 hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his two children. 

Feri owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and accessories to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system, as well as to give more contribution to his community. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Feri needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Feri’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

As seen in the photo, Feri is the one who is standing in front of his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his village community.

loans.name: Sarah`s Group

texts.en:
Sarah (first from the left) is aged 28, single with one child. Sarah earns her income to look after her family through farming. Sarah grows beans, maize, millet and banana. She also has goats and chickens. 

Sarah and her group members have attended five trainings on farming as a business and have learned new ways through which they can improve their farm yields. They requested a loan so as to put the knowledge learned into practice. They will use this loan to purchase good-quality seeds, herbicides and fertilizers for their gardens.

Sarah`s dream is to work hard, look after her children, and live a happier life.

loans.use: to purchase good quality seeds, herbicides and fertilizers for their gardens.

loans.name: Mwenda Pole Group

texts.en:
Christina is in her late 20s, married and has one child who attends school. For two years she has been supporting her family by running a beauty salon. Working from 10 am to 9 pm each working day, she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is Christina's third loan request from Kiva partner's Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, paid back in full, to buy salon hair dressing items. Doing well and thankful to everyone for their support, she dreams of one day managing a shop selling dry foods. 

With this new credit request, Christina plans to buy hair dressing equipment for her salon. She will share this loan with her group MWENDA POLE, consisting of three members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy hair dressing equipment for her salon

loans.name: Jhan Edil

texts.es:
Jhan Edil tiene 21 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia; domiciliado en CASERIO SANTA RITA, en el distrito de Oyotun, Provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa norte de Perú, la cual es una zona rural, dedicada a la agricultura, el comercio y ganadería.

Él se dedica a brindar servicio de jornaleria; hace 4 años dentro del mismo caserío donde vive, con muy buenas referencias, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, Jhan Edil solicita préstamo para invertir en Activo fijo; compra de una mochila para fumigar; fertilizantes, entre otros, esto le servira para tener en mejores condiciones sus herramientas y darle una mejor apariencia, para poder brindar mejores servicios, así mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jhan Edil is 21 years old. He is single, and he does not have any children. He lives in his own house in the town of Santa Rita, which is located in the Oyotun district, which belongs to the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru. This is a rural area where the people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. 

He makes a living providing day laborer services. He started this business 4 years ago in the town where he lives with very good references. His business is located inside his home.

Jhan Edil is requesting a loan, which he will invest in fixed assets. He will buy a fumigation backpack and fertilizers, among other things. This loan will help him have his tools in better condition and give them a better appearance in order to provide better services. This way, he will improve his income and, ultimately, his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a fumigation backpack and fertilizers, among other things.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 37 years old and is married with three children, all attending school, living in Kasese, Uganda. He sells second-hand clothes and owns a motorcycle in order to earn his side income. He has a dream of constructing a residential house and looking after his family in order to have a better life in future. 

Lawrence is requesting a loan to buy second-hand clothes for selling although he is faced with high market competition and limited capital which hinders the success of his business in the area.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his coffee farm and buy coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Khairani

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Khairani, one of Ruma’s agents. Khairani lives in Semarang, the capital of Central Java, 9 hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Khairani is a university student who has a great desire to become an entrepreneur. She owns a stall that provides  photocopy service for documents and she sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago. She knew about Ruma from a sales executive that came to her stall, and she decided to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business in technology.

As the business grows, Khairani is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. This is important to her and your loan will be very useful to help Khairani improve her business and her community, who need access to such services. 

Khairani's goal in regard to Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, which is part of Ruma's latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Khairani is sitting in her own stall. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her local community better access to communication service by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Kazindiro Tukore Group

texts.en:
Akim is a repeat client of this institution and he is the tallest man in the group photo standing at the etreme left. He decided to form a group called Kazindiro Tukore group located in Kazindiro parish, Bugagari Sub County.

Akim is the chairperson of the group. He is aged 40 years and married with 4 children. Akim is a businessman and operates a retail shop at a local trading centre. Besides owning a shop, he also carries out agriculture in the form of a coffee plantation and cattle rearing.

The group approached UGAFODE for a loan. Akim will specifically use his to buy more stock such as sacks of sugar, maize flour, tomatoes, rice and scholastic materials to sell in his shop.

The group members thank UGAFODE for the tremendous financial support advanced to them.

loans.use: to buy stock such as sacks of sugar, maize flour, tomatoes, rice and scholastic materials to sell in his shop, and boost his retail business.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana, her husband, and their two children live happily in Sisian town. The only worker in the family was Liana's husband, who is an electrician by profession. 

Last year, Liana started her own business: selling fruits and vegetables at retail. She usually purchases a large variety of fruits and vegetables in bulk, takes them to nearby communities, and sells them there. 

Liana's husband helps her to transport her products to market. Summer holidays have started in the schools, so their two children also help their mother with the retail business. 

Liana is requesting this loan to be able to invest in her business and enlarge her income for the family.

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan requested by LIana will be used in purchasing vegetables and fruits in bulk to resell at higher and profitable prices. 
This is her first deal with Kiva, so she greatly hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for vegetables and fruits in bulk to resell  in the market

loans.name: Naa

texts.en:
Naa is 41 years old. She has four children, who are between the ages of 8 and 21.  She is a widow, and as a single mother, she is the only one responsible for the upbringing of her children. She is a water vendor.  Naa has been selling water for two years now.

Manhea is a newly developed town within the Greater Accra Metropolis. Most households lack piped water. Naa usually buys water from water tankers and resell it to members of her community in buckets and gallons. 

She will use this loan to purchase a water storage tank to store more water and resell it. She believes this will help her business to expand.

loans.use: To purchase a tank for water storage

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a hardworking man aged 35 years old,  a resident of rubiri,Nyamiryobora, Mbarara   He is married with 4 children. 
All his children are in good schools in Mbarara town and this gentleman has rentals and is even a taxi driver.

He has requested for a loan of UGX3000,000/= to renovate his rentals. He says he wants to expand his rentals from money which he has requested money for and he thought developing it will give him more output, which will increase his earnings.

loans.use: To renovate his rentals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of sachet water for resale

loans.name: Carla Jimena

texts.es:
Carla es una mujer de 46 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo, y su negocio es la repostería.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, activa, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Coña coña’ ubicada al noreste de la ciudad, donde se encuentra una laguna utilizada como escenario de deportes acuáticos como competencias de botes a vela, y otros relacionados. De clima templado y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-25 grados centígrados.
Carla es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela y le ayuda en el negocio, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba. Su deseo por mejorar sus ingresos la llevó a solicitar un préstamo para mejorar su negocio y poder pagar los gastos escolares de su hijo. Su negocio es la repostería y se especializa en la venta diaria de cupcakes y galletas. El cupcake que es una porción de tarta para una persona que se hornea en un molde, “horneamos y decoramos tartas, cupcakes, galletas y demás especialidades para ocasiones especiales, lo realizamos por encargo, ya que son trabajos personalizados…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias y trabajos extras personalizados, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de materiales de repostería, como moldes, harina, azúcar, huevo, esencias, y otros. Su sueño es abrir una repostería en el centro de la ciudad, ella desea incrementar sus ventas mediante la compra de insumos de repostería para aumentar la cantidad de ofertas de tartas y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de su hijo. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carla solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de repostería para hornear más tartas y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de su hijo.
texts.en:
Carla is a 46 year-old woman who is single and has a son.  She has a bakery business. She is a good mother who is enterprising, independent, active, reliable, responsible, and very hardworking.  She carries out her business in the Coña coña neighborhood in the northeastern part of the city.  Here there is a lake used for aquatic sports such as sailboat competitions and other water sports.  The area has a mild and dry climate with a daytime temperature that varies between 18-25 degrees Celsius.   Carla has a dark complexion, brown eyes, brown hair that is tied back, a short stature, and a medium physique.  Her native language is Quechua, which she speaks in her home, and she also speaks Spanish in the general culture and in her business.  She shares her life with her son, who attends school and helps her with the business.  They live in a house made of brick, and cement.  The house has a tin roof, and has electricity and well water accessed by a pump.      

Carla's desire to increase her income led her to request a loan to improve her business and pay for the educational expenses of her son.  She has a bakery business, and she specializes in making cupcakes and cookies.  A cupcake is a portion of cake for one person that is baked in a mold.  "We bake and decorate cakes, cupcakes, cookies, and other baked goods for special occasions.  We do our business through orders, because our work is personalized," she comments.        

The advantage of Carla's business is that she has daily sales and extra personalized work, the disadvantage is that she lacks the capital to buy supplies for her bakery such as molds, flour, sugar, eggs, extracts, and other items.  Carla's dream is to open a bakery in the center of the city.  She wants to increase her sales by purchasing bakery supplies to expand her offerings of cakes. With the profits, she will pay for the educational expenses for her son. This is her 2nd loan with the institution in the 7 years that she has been developing her business.

This is why Carla is requesting a loan to buy bakery supplies to bake more cakes, so that with the profits she can pay for her son's educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy bakery supplies

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is single, and she lives at her father's house.

Carmen makes cheese and sells her products at fairs every Sunday.  She needs a loan to buy a milk cow because she wants to increase her milk production. She also helps her father.

Carmen is the only one at the house who earns money. That is why she needs your help

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: María Alexandra

texts.es:
Emprendedora, sonriente, capaz, luchadora así es María una mujer que monto un negocio de venta de bolsos y bisutería todo enfocado a la mujer, un almacén que comenzó con el sueño de comprar una vivienda propia y que gracias a su capacidades y perseverancia ha hecho crecer.

María es una mujer soltera que no tienen hijos, es la fuente principal de dinero en su hogar donde asiste y mantiene a sus padres, pero espera un día lograr su independencia y solo lo quiere hacer en una vivienda propia.

Trabaja de lunes a sábado 11 horas diarias, siempre está pendiente de las nuevas modas que salen para estar a la vanguardia de posibles pedidos de sus clientes es por esta razón que quiere solicitar un préstamo para actualizar la exhibición de bisutería de su tienda comprando surtido de estos productos y de bolsos, con un fin de llamar la atención de sus compradoras.
texts.en:
Maria is an enterprising, smiling, capable and tenacious woman who started a business selling handbags and fashion jewellery for women. She opened  the store with the dream of buying her own home, and it has grown thanks to her managing ability and perseverance.

Maria is single and she has no children. She is the main source of income for the household where she assists and supports her parents. She is looking to attain independence one day but only by living in her own home.

She works eleven hours a day from Monday to Saturday. She is  always aware of emerging fashion trends in order to anticipate demand from her clients. She is applying for a loan to update the jewellery displays in her store by buying a variety of these products and also bags, attracting in this way her clients' interest.

loans.use: to update the jewellery displays in her store by buying a variety of these products and also bags

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is married, with a 4-year-old child.  She lives with her parents-in-law because her husband is a migrant laborer in neighboring country, who supports his family financially.  

To help her family with daily earning, Narine started her own business two years ago:  She got involved in retail business.  The business model of Narine works as follows:  She purchases clothing and cosmetics supplies in the market, takes part of them to nearby villages, and exchanges them for agricultural products. 

Narine works really hard to help her family with income for covering basic costs. The result of her hard work has started to appear, and she was able to gather good income from her selling activities. 

She has now applied for this loan to ask lenders for support. She needs financial help to invest on her business and boost sales. 

Narine has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of clothing and cosmetics supplies to sell to her clients

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is married and her husband is a mason.  She sells milk and she needs a loan to buy a milking cow in order to increase her milk production 

Hilaria is mother of one child and she is the owner of the family house. Hilaria hopes you can help her she would like to sell cheese in the future and she is healthy She is at the farm in the picture

loans.use: to buy a milking cow for increased milk production and sales

loans.name: Kipawa Group

texts.en:
Magreth, a businesswoman in her 50s, is married with eight grown children. She has a gengeduka (grocery shop) business selling fruits, vegetables and other foods like maize, baking flour, sugar,and cooking oil. She has been in this business for 20 years, working from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. each working day. She is doing great and wishes to expand her business. Magreth is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is Magreth's 18th credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, which she has paid back successfully, to improve her gengeduka business, buying more fruits, vegetables, cooking oil, sugar, maize and baking flour. Magreth managed to make a profit which she used to cover her daily expenses. She also bought a plot of land for building a house. She is really happy and appreciates Kiva's support. In the coming years, she would like to expand her business. 

She will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetable for her gengeduka business. Magreth will share this loan with her group, Kipawa, which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her grocery business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy drinks for the grocery store and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Haguruka Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 52 years old, married, and has two children. She is the group leader of Haguruka, which means “stand up” in English. They sell different products and wish to expand their businesses for improving their future. 

Agnes owns a restaurant, which she has been doing for 12 years. She requested, a loan, which she will use to buy more rice, bananas, and cassava to sell. The profits will be used to expand her business and improve her welfare.

loans.use: to purchase rice, bananas, and cassava to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Jyambere Cb Group

texts.en:
Clementine is a group leader; aged 40 years.She is married with 5 children aged between 6 ans 15 years. 

The group is called JYAMBERE means “Go ahead” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She sells foodstuffs and has been running in a business for 3 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, bananas and cassava for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of children and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more rice, bananas and cassava for sale, to help with paying school fees

loans.name: Wilber Noe

texts.es:
Wilber, de 38 años de edad, está casado, es agricultor, no estudio, aunque a medida de que paso el tiempo ha aprendido mucho, tiene tres hijos y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Wilber, es agricultor y también  trabaja de motorista en el trasporte público y transporte turístico, aprendió a manejar cuando trabajaba de corralero y su patrón le pedía que llevara leche hasta la casa cuando él no tenía tiempo de ir, además hala leña para que su esposa cocine los alimentos.

Wilber, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas, foliares, etc. porque se acerca el tiempo para preparar la tierra.

En el futuro Wilber, sueña con que sus hijos se gradúen y tengan mejores  oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Wilber, age 38, is married and a farmer. He never went to school, though over the years he has learned a lot. He has three children and his wife runs the household.

In addition to being a farmer, Wilber is also a driver for public and tourist transportation. He learned to drive when he was working as a cattlehand and his boss asked him to take milk to the house when he didn't have time to go. He also supplies the wood that his wife uses to cook the food.

Wilber needs this loan so that he can buy farming supplies such as manure, pesticides, foliars (leaf treatments), etc, because it's getting close to time to prepare the land.

In the future, Wilber wants to see his children graduate and have better work opportunities.

loans.use: to prepare his land by buying manure, pesticides, and leaf treatments

loans.name: Elina Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Elina de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la agricultura posee 35 años  de experiencia e inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los meses de mayo y junio en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, ella  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, controles de plagas, insecticida y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder tener un buen cultivo que le pueda generar mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Elina, 53, lives in her own house with her family. She works in agriculture. She has 35 years of experience and she started out with her own resources. Elina sells her products in May and June at the different markets that are near her house. Elina is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, manure, pest applications, and insecticide. She also wants to improve the land shown in the photograph in order to have a good crop so she can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, manure, pest applications, and insecticide.

loans.name: Parachichi Group

texts.en:
Abubakar, a tailor for eight years, now,dreams of improving his business with electric tailoring machines and a variety of clothing materials. To him, working hard with Kiva's support will enable him to see his dreams come true. 

Abubakar is in his mid 50s and has two children in school. He works from 7:30 a.m. to 9 p.m. each working day. Abubakari is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is Abubakar's fourth credit request through Tujijenge Tanzania. He will receive a portion of the loan to Parachichi, a two-member group. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Abubakar has paid back the previous loans, which he used to buy tailoring fabrics and to pay office rent. He is doing great and wishes to build a house for his family. He received some extra income which he used to cover school fees and to buy a plot of land. 

He will use this loan to buy clothes-making materials.

loans.use: to buy clothes-making materials.

loans.name: Hendra

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Hendra, one of Ruma's agents. Hendra lives in Majalengka, a regency in West Java, located about 5 hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his children. 

Hendra owns a stall that sells small snacks and drinks and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system, as well as to give more contribution to his community. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Hendra needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Hendra’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

As seen in the photo, Hendra is the one who is at his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his village community.

loans.name: Vinita

texts.en:
Vinita is an artisan from Thailand who specializes in batik accessories. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of fabric for her designs.

Vinita has been selling through Novica since 2012. This is her story:

"I studied fine art and discovered my true identity: I express myself through tangible art, especially by creating unique colors with batik apparel. After marriage, we decided to follow our dreams for our children to grow in a place of peace and beauty with a simple lifestyle. I focus on textile arts and mix the dyes myself. My family is a family of artists; my husband and my children are art graduates. Our happiness is expressed in our art work."

"I plan to expand my product line and create new designs. I'll need to buy fabric in bulk in order to get a good price as well as consistent colors and patterns. I am so happy to be able to get a loan without any interest. This program really helps artisans like myself a lot. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Vinita's batik accessories on the Novica site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8756

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of fabric for her designs

loans.name: Menyankumenye Group

texts.en:
MENYANKUMENYE is a group led by Laurence who is 46 years old. The group name means “let's know each other” in English. She is married with 5 children aged between 7 and 20 years. She has a shop and has been doing business for the past 6 years. 

The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, sugar; salt and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar; salt and cooking oil for selling at her store to help pay for school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a new toilet facility in her household

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To receive and sell 130 units of BrightBox to both rural and urban end-users in Kenya.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.es:
Marianita  es casada y tiene 2 hijos vive en la ciudad de Encarnación, actualmente está trabajando como diseñadora, pero está estudiando la carrera de diseño gráfico para poder perfeccionar sus conocimientos.
Comenta que es muy difícil trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo, más aun siendo madre, ella se esfuerza para poder salir adelante y dar a su familia una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Marianita is married and has 2 children. She lives in the city of Encarnación. She currently works as a designer, but she is studying graphic design in order to refine her knowledge.

Marianita says that it is very difficult to work and study at the same time, even more so being a mother. She strives to get ahead and give her family a decent life. Marianita is requesting this loan to pay for tuition fees and thus continue studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 38 years old and she is a single mother.  She lives at what was her mother's house, where she makes and sells pastries.  She wakes up very early in the morning to cook and then she distributes her pastries at schools and other places.

She needs a loan to buy sugar, flour, salt and other ingredients that now are more expensive.  Salome is healthy and she has experience selling pastries and she hopes you can help her because she lives only with her child.   Her mother died many years ago, so she is alone

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, salt and other ingredients that now are more expensive

loans.name: Tropia Group

texts.en:
Elice, who is in her early 40s, is single with two children, one is still in school and the other one is too yoing.  She has been running a grocery store for four and half years now.  She works from 4pm to mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Elice's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to keep on increase the drinks stock and has paid back all her loan successfully and was happy with the loan.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy drinks for her grocery store and meet her customers' demand.  She dreams of owning a big grocery.

Elice will share this loan with her loan group TROPIA which consist of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her grocery store and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To receive and sell 140 units of BrightBox to both rural and urban end-users in Kenya.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To receive and sell 140 units of BrightBox to both rural and urban end-users in Kenya.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda Esta luchando para poder terminar sus estudios, esta poniendo el mayor de sus esfuerzos, ya que a medida que corren los años es un poco mas difícil, su meta es poder volverse una profesional exitosa, y es por ello que esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo.
Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus estudios, hoy quiere volver a invertir en el pago de sus cuotas, es por eso que pide este préstamo. agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Hilda is striving to finish her studies. She is putting forth her best efforts since as the years go by, it gets harder. Her goal is to become a successful professional and that's why she is putting forth her best effort.

Hilda says that her previous loan was used to pay for tuition fees, which helped a lot so that she could keep studying. Now, she is requesting another loan  to pay for her tuition fees. She is grateful for getting this new opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.en:
Cinthia is 19 years old and she works as a seamstress assistant.  She also is going to the university.  She lives with her parents but all the members in the family are working because there are many expenses and Cinthia's parents need help.  

She needs a loan to buy fabrics.  Cinthia would like to start her own production of clothes, so she hopes you can help her

loans.use: to buy fabric to produce clothes to sell, which also helps with university fees

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida earns money by selling milk and she needs a loan to buy a milking cow.   Adelaida is alone, so she does not have any relative who can help her. That is why she needs your help.  

Her boyfriend is a mason but he is not living with her and he has his own expenses.  Adelaida works hard, as she has been in the milk business since she was a child, so she is experienced

loans.use: to buy a milking cow, to increase milk production for her income

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children. One is in school and the other one is still small. She has been making and selling mixed flours called lishe for five years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mariamu's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to improve and increase her stock. She is doing fine and has paid back all her loans successfully.

She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, built a house, bought a farm,  repaid her loan, and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy wheat flour, baking flour, maize, rice, beans, soy, etc. to make a mixed flour called lishe. She dreams of building another house.

Mariamu will make sure she pays her loan within the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, baking flour, maize, rice, beans, soy, etc. to make a mixed flour called lishe.

loans.name: ...umunezero Tcb... Group

texts.en:
Djamila is a group leader; aged 38 years.She is married with 3 children aged between 7 and 11 years. The group is called UMUNEZERO means “Happiness” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing for a better future. She has a beauty salon and has been running the business for several years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more salon equipment for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more beauty salon equipment for sale, to help pay school fees

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 51 years old now.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food vending business.

Esterlita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Esterlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 33 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Fe has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Jenibeth

texts.en:
Jenibeth is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and has four children who are in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Jenibeth has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies. She has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Jenibeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Peace's Group

texts.en:
Peace (first from the left) is 38 years, married with five children and she lives in Kivengenyi village Kasese district. Peace is a smallholder farmer and she grows oranges, mangoes, passion fruits, which sales earn her a living.
 
Peace mobilized and leads a group of five fellow member farmers who actively participate in trainings organized by YICE on farming as business. As result of these trainings, group members leaned that their farm output has always been low because of poor quality seeds, lack of fertilizers and poor crop handling.  The group now request for a loan so as to buy fertilizers, herbicides and good quality sees in order to boost their farm output. 

Peace’s dream is to become a model farmer and inspire other community members to start farming as a source of income for their livelihoods.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and good quality seeds in order to boost their farm yields

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is one of Ruma's agents, Eka. He just joined Ruma last year. 

Eka lives in Sumedang, located in West Java, about 4-5 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only child. Eka owns a stall that sells mobile air time credits and provide electricity bill payment services to his community. He decided to join Ruma last year because he wants to start to become an entrepreneur, as well as provide more contribution to his community. Eka is really excited to be a part of Ruma’s network because it is something new for him. His community sees him as a trusted and informed mobile provider.

With the support and assistance from Ruma staff, he is now offering to process mobile payment services for customers. He is requesting a Kiva loan to help him to purchase more mobile payment services. His goal for his business is to become a trusted mobile payment service provider for his community. 

Eka is the one who is seen in the photo. He will be thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide bill payment service and sell mobile airtime credits to give his village community better access to communication and financial services.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tajiri Village. Musa joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Musa will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds, that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize.

This season, Musa has grand plans to harvest 30 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Musa now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields

loans.name: Rosalino

texts.es:
El Sr. Rosalino es separado actualmente, vive con su hijo menor y por quien está luchando para poder sacarlo adelante. Está trabajando en una empresa privada  y estudiando la carrera de derecho para que al recibirse pueda  aumentar sus ingresos y  dar una vida digna a su hijo, por quien esta luchando tanto.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Rosalino is currently divorced. He lives with his youngest son and that's who he is striving to provide for. Rosalino works at a private company and is studying for a degree in law so that when he finishes, his income will increase and he will be able to give his son a decent life. Rosalino is requesting this loan to pay for tuition fees and thus continue studying as he has been.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco viene de una familia de escasos recursos económicos, está estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en educación artística, para poder cubrir ayudar a sus padres por medio de su profesión.
Él quiere abrirse camino y el día de mañana ser un profesional útil, no solo a sí mismo, sino también a los demás.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir luchando por cumplir con su anhelada meta.
texts.en: Francisco comes from a family with low economic resources. He is studying to be an Educational Art teacher in order to be able to help his family through his profession. He wants to open doors and become a useful professional not only for himself but also for others. He is requesting this loan to pay his university tuition and doing this continue fighting to attain his longed for goal.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a widowed woman and 73 years old with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

Dolores has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for 40 years. Dolores would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 58 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Rebecca has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 45 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Lucita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like beverages, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Lucita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, eggs, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a married woman and 47 years old with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

Angelica has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials for her business. Angelica has been in this business for 25 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 47 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Remedios works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like biscuits, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Remedios has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy item to sell like biscuits, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman, 53 years old with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elsa has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials to her business.

Elsa has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials to her business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. Rosalina is married and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

Rosalina requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosalina has been in this business for 16 years now.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
It was only a year ago that Antonio opened up his shop, Canela Bakery, Cafe & Deli in Newark, NJ after retiring from a long career as an engineer. Since then he has seen great success as customers flock from around Newark to get a taste of his delicious cakes, pastries, and breakfast sandwiches. 

Thanks to the recognition he has received through his cake delivery service, Antonio has decided to patent one of his cakes to protect his special recipe as he shares them with a growing clientele. Antonio is requesting this loan in order to expand his current cafe into a new business called Cinnamon Sugar Bakery Corporation. 

With this new business he will expand his client base into New York and share the delicious products of his baking talents throughout the region.

loans.use: to distribute cakes from his bakery across New York and New Jersey

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Nenita is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Letecia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
