Sofia está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, sus metas son la de culminar sus estudios, y poder crecer profesionalmente.
Quiere poder trabajar en empresas, donde pueda aplicar todo lo que aprendió.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere cubrir las cuotas de su universidad, y así poder seguir con sus estudios
texts.en: Sofia is studying for a degree in accounting. Her goals are to finish her studies and to grow professionally. She wants to work in companies where she can apply what she's learned. Sofia is requesting this loan to pay for tuition fees and thus continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Pindoty Group

texts.es:
El comité PINDOTY, es un grupo muy unido de 17 integrantes, todas ellas son de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona rural aun en crecimiento, y de difícil acceso, donde todas se dedican a actividades rurales.
La Sra. Irma, es muy emprendedora y se desempeña como modista, trabaja conjuntamente con una casa de confecciones de la localidad, y comenta que le está yendo muy bien, ya que por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros productos para poder seguir haciendo sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The "PINDOTY" communal bank is a very united group with 17 members. They are all from the city of Santaní, a rural zone still in development and with poor access where they all work in rural activities.

Irma is very entrepreneurial and works as a dressmaker. She works together with a local sewing establishment. She comments that things are going very well as through her work she has the means to help her family and her loved ones. She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other products for sewing so that she can continue to do her sewing as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and other products for sewing.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 57-year-old farmer from the town of Alegria, Cebu. She is married with five children and her youngest is 15 years old. She works hard in her farm growing rice to provide for her family. She also raises cattle for additional income. 

Lydia is requesting a loan at CEVI to buy fertilizer and pesticides. She is confident that this will contribute to healthy and abundant crops in the future. Lydia plans to repair her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family.  Erlinda is widowed with six children and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

SHe requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials to her business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 50 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials to her business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marites is 41 years old and has five children are still in school.

Marites has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, additional bamboo and other materials to her business.

Marites has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, additional bamboo and other materials to her dried fish business

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Melanie is 18 years old and is 1st of three children in the family. Her mother Estela supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Melanie is studying for her bachelor of arts in development communication and is currently in the 2nd of this 4 years-year course.

Estela is borrowing 4000 to pay tuition fees of her daughter for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Melanie plans to graduate and be gainfully employed

loans.use: to pay 2nd year college tuition fees in Development Communication

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a 27-year-old woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Annaliza has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is a hardworking woman and entrepreneur with three children. She runs a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store. Angie dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Daylen

texts.en:
Daylen is 25 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Daylen has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Daylen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in galvanized steel sheets, wood, nails and wire to build a bedroom

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 38 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. He is a farmer and he grows cash crops for sell. 

He will be using the loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce for sale and make more income for sell. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hopes are to improve his farming, make more income and support his family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm so as to get more farm produce for sale and get more income to support his family.

loans.name: Cristin

texts.en:
Cristin is 31 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Cristin has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending. Cristin aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 57 years old and has five children.  She is married and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Dolores has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Dolores has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelly is 38 years old and has four children are currently in school.

Nelly has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Nelly requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials to her business.

Nelly has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her dried fish business

loans.name: Soraida

texts.en:
Soraida works hard to support her family. Soraida is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

Soraida requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials to her business.

Soraida has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Nasani

texts.en:
Nasani is a hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy manure and seedlings for his farm. He still deals in farming as his main source of income, alongside owning a retail shop where he earns extra income. 

Nasani still hopes to become a leading farmer supplying maize and beans through out the year which will in turn increase his profits. However, his main challenge is price fluctuations of agricultural products and pests and diseases. In order to improve on soil fertility,Nasani is requesting a loan to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Rufino Antonio

texts.es:
Rufino es pescador de nacimiento ha vivido toda su vida a orillas  del mar, él es un hombre muy reconocido en su zona por la calidad de sus mariscos, pues antes del amanecer zarpa hacia alta mar, para obtener los mejores peces que le han hecho ganar una enorme clientela. Él se siente agradecido con MiCrédito porque gracias al último financiamiento pudo comprar un freezer que le fue de mucha utilidad en su venta de mariscos.

Por ello, solicita un crédito para comprar hilos de pesca y unos repuestos del motor de su lancha, esto le será de ayuda porque tendrá más redes de pesca y podrá reparar su medio de trabajo. Rufino planea aliarse con empresas más grandes, además de abrir otro local.
texts.en:
Rufino is a fisherman by birth and has lived by the sea all his life. He is a man who is recognised in his area for the quality of his seafood. This is because he sails out to sea before dawn to get the best fish and, as a result, he has won a huge client base. He is very grateful to MiCrédito as, thanks to the last loan, he was able to buy a freezer which has been very useful in selling his seafood.

He is therefore requesting a loan to buy fishing lines and spare parts for the motor on his boat. This will help him as he will have more fishing nets and will be able to repair his means of work. Rufino plans to form an alliance with some larger companies and open another store.

loans.use: to buy fishing lines and spare parts for the motor on his boat

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is married. He has a son and his own house. Ronald is a cellphone seller. He goes to many fairs and he sells the cellphones. 

Ronald needs a loan to buy more cellphones for his business. He is convinced he can sell more although he has to travel a lot. He is ready to make sacrifices for his family. His wife is not working right now so he is the only person at his house that brings in money. 

Ronald hopes you can help him. As you can see in the picture, Ronald is with the cellphones at one of the many fairs where he goes to sell the products.

loans.use: to buy more cellphones for his business

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es:
Gualberto sigue con su trabajo de ventas de frutas y verduras, además tiene su camión con el que hace fletes, viaja a varias ciudades y hace su trabajo de transportes. el se define a si mismo como una persona que se esfuerza y lucha para poder salir adelante.
Comenta que utilizo su préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras para la venta, lo que le fue muy útil, hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder hacer un buen mantenimiento para su camión.
texts.en: Gualberto continues his work selling fruit and vegetables. He also has a truck that he does deliveries with. He travels to a variety of cities to do his transportation work. He defines himself as a person who makes an effort and fights to be able to get ahead. He says that he used his previous loan to buy fruit and vegetables to sell and that it was very useful. Today he is requesting another loan to have maintenance done on his truck.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seedlings for planting for high production and supply for for more income gain.

loans.name: Febelina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Febelina works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Febelina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy wheels and spare parts for her passenger tricycle. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her passenger tricycle.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Gina is 46 years old and has one child in school. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

Ma. Gina has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her business. She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma. Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell for her business.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 24 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and mother-in-law in Khelvachauri district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cows and Tamar produces cheese everyday to sell. In addition, they have mandarin trees and sell the harvest locally. 

As the income is not enough for the family, Tamar requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan for purchasing a car. As the car is purchased, her husband will serve locals as the taxi driver and they will be able to generate income. 

With increased income family will improve the living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband to serve locals as a taxi driver in order to increase family income

loans.name: Ariel Alexander

texts.es:
Para algunas personas, los números son su peor enemigo, sin embargo, para Ariel son una forma de decir la verdad y ser justo. Desde pequeño este joven de 22 años de edad, se vio estudiando Contaduría Pública, ahora está en quinto año de la carrera y no se arrepiente ni un segundo en haber tomado esa decisión. En estos momentos se siente realizado profesionalmente, porque sigue aprendiendo en la universidad. Además debido a su desempeño académico está trabajando como asistente en su misma universidad, lo que le ha permitido poner en práctica lo que le enseñan. 
Afortunadamente Ariel cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, su mamá es costurera y su papá se fue buscando el sueño americano, por lo que recibe remesas desde Estados Unidos de él. Ahora que solo faltan unos meses para culminar sus estudios, solicita un préstamo para pagar el título y el certificado de notas, puesto que con esto podrá graduarse y tener mejores oportunidades laborales. En sus planes está ejercer en otro lugar su carrera.
texts.en:
Some people consider numbers to be their worst enemy. However, for Ariel, numbers are a way to tell the truth and to be just. Since childhood, this 22-year-old young man has wanted to study public accounting. He is now in his fifth year of studies, and he does not regret even for a second having taken this decision. Currently, he feels fulfilled professionally because he continues to learn at his university. In addition, as a result of his academic performance, he is working as an assistant at the university. This job has allowed him to put into practice what he has been taught.

Fortunately, Ariel has the support of his parents. His mother is a seamstress. His father left looking for the American dream, and Ariel receives money from him from the United States. Now that he is only a few months away from finishing his studies, he is requesting a loan to pay for his degree as well as his transcript. This way, he will be able to graduate, which will give him better job opportunities. He plans to pursue his career in another place.

loans.use: to pay for his degree as well as his transcript.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josefina is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Josefina has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar, etc. for her food production business. She has been in this business for 10 years. Josefina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a 28 years old, married and has two children. She wants to help her husband provide for their children by earning income so she started a food-stall business. She cooks food and sells it to the community. Lilibeth aims to increase her income so she requested a loan to buy additional ingredients for a new menu. That will result in more sales and more income.

Lilibeth's plan for the future is to use her increased income to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for new menu.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a mother of four children and she is 47. She wants to earn income so that she can be able to provide her family's daily needs, so she is engaged in a food vending business. 

Nilda is always dreaming of better lives for her family so she decided to access a loan to purchase additional ingredients for a new menu of foods to sell that will generate greater income that will help them a lot with their daily needs.

Nilda's plan for the future is to save money out of her business income.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for a new menu of foods to sell.

loans.name: Ana Donna

texts.en:
Ana Donna is a hard-working entrepreneur with two children.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 60,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional rice to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures including a general store.

Ana Donna dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Arrien

texts.en:
Arrien is a 36-year-old married mother of four children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Arrien has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. Arrien requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Arrien has been in this business for four years. In the future, Arrien would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lovelina

texts.en:
Lovelina is 25 years old, married and has two children, one currently in school.

Lovelina is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Lovelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lovelina has been raising livestock for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Lovelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Judy is 49 years old and has one child who is in school.

Judy has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

Judy has been in this business for three years. In the future, Judy would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marlene is 39 years old and both of her children attend school.

Marlene has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marlene requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Marlene has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Marlene would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Glenjhel

texts.en:
Glenjhel is 38 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Glenjhel works very hard to provide for them.

Glenjhel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Glenjhel has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Glenjhel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Sopo Jadi Group

texts.en:
Agus strives to improve his family’s economic conditions. He has been running a small-scale vegetable farm and has a few cows to fatten and to sell. His business is going quite well. However, he was deeply concerned to see a high price and scarcity of non-renewable cooking gas, high price of chemical fertilizers, and also seeing the cow dung wasted without further processing, while polluting the air with a pungent odor. 

After socializing by Yayasan Rumah Energi (YRE) and Lembaga Pengembangan Pertanian Nahdatul Ulama/LPPNU (a local NGO – biogas construction partner of YRE) about the Household Biogas (BIRU) program, Agus sees that biogas is a good solution for his problems. He sees an opportunity to reduce his dependence on non-renewable cooking gas. In addition, he also wants to use bio-slurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer for his plants. In order to make it happen, Agus invited eight of his friends above to form a farmer group. He is so keen to purchase a bio-digester, but he does not have sufficient capital for it. A loan from Kiva will help him and the other farmer group members to make it possible. 

Agus has optimism that if he can build a bio-digester, he can use the biogas for cooking, and bio-slurry (biogas residue) as fertilizer for his plantation. He also wants to sell the remaining bio-slurry to increase his family income. He hopes that in the future, he can invite all of the farmers in his village to use biogas.

loans.use: to build a bio-digester facility and utilize the biogas residues as organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is thankful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. Aside from her small store she also has a videoke business as seen in her photo.

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods which she sells at retail. Part of the loan she will use to maaintain her videoke machine. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for her four children's schooling. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Susan dreams that her small store will grow into a big grocery store someday. She prays for good health and long life.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store plus the ingredients she uses to produce the meals she sells.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 57 years old and widowed with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Paulina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

Paulina has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, canned goods, vinegar, candies, sugar and other groceries.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

Josie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for three years now. Josie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dorinda

texts.en:
Dorinda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Dorinda is 51 years old and has five children who are in school.

Dorinda has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shirts, pants, etc.

Dorinda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Dorinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shirts, pants etc.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 47 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, home care products, personal care products, and other groceries.

Melchora has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Melchora aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, home care products, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Souweba

texts.fr: Souweba vit à Agoè et est âgée de 36 ans. Souweba est une femme mariée avec six personnes à sa charge. Souweba vend des l’eau ensachée en parcourant tout le quartier et arrive à vendre grâce à son dynamisme. Souweba  s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sachets d’eau, Souweba demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer le profit nécessaire pour aider ses enfants dans les diverses charges quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Souweba lives in Agoè and is aged 36. She is a married woman supporting six people. She sells drinking water in plastic bags by walking through the neighborhood, and she manages to sell her wares thanks to her dynamic nature. 

Souweba stocks up on water three times a month in the market. To place an order for bags of water, Souweba is requesting this loan so that she can complete her purchase and make the necessary profit so that she can help her children with their various daily expenditures.

loans.use: to buy 67 plastic bags of water

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 47 years old and married with two children. Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soy sauce, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Alicia has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soy sauce, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 40 years old and married with three children. With all three children in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 33 years old and separated, and she has three children to provide for. As a single mother, she wants to give her children a better life, so she started a sari sari store business to earn a living.

She wants a better income so that she can provide for her children's daily needs, so she decided to borrow a loan to buy more goods to sell. Having more store inventory will enable her to generate more sales and thus more income.

Arlyn's plan for the future is to save money out from her business income.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Rhys

texts.en:
Habal-habal is a transportation service using a motorcycle in some remote places of the Philippines. For many years, this has been Rhys' source of income. He is asking a loan from CEVI to pay for motorcycle repair. 

Rhys works hard for his young son. In the future, he plans to have other businesses to better support the needs of his family and his son's education. Rhys is 25 years old from Badian, Cebu.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle repair

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 33 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Jesusa has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She has a food vending in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs. Marivic dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money, so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: A 30 ans, Yawa est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Yawa vit dans le quartier de Tokoin et pour répondre aux besoins de la famille, Yawa vend des chaussures et sacs de sortie en dans le quartier et ses environs. Yawa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Yawa nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des chaussures afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
At 30 years of age, Yawa is a married woman and the mother of four children. She lives in the district called Tokoin, and to meet the needs of the family, Yawa sells shoes and handbags in the surrounding neighborhoods. She stocks up four times a month in the market. 

Yawa needs this loan to buy some shoes so as to make more profit and help her children out with their school expenses.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana está estudiando para ser abogada, pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser una profesional útil no solo a sí misma, sino también para los demás.
Ella comenta que está haciendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder cumplir con sus metas y anhelos.
Eliana pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Eliana is studying to become a lawyer. She puts forth her best effort so that she can be a useful professional not only for herself, but also for others. She states that she is doing her best in order to fulfill her goals and dreams. 

Eliana is requesting a loan to pay her university fees. This way, she will be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electrical cable, breaker box and screws in order to be able to install electricity

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 41 years old and married with four children in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Regina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Regina has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits, candies, shampoo, soap, and other groceries.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. In the future, Regina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou vit à Agoè et est âgée de 47 ans. Mariée, Akou est mère de trois enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Akou vend des pagnes dans sa boutique du quartier pour avoir son revenu pour leur subsistance. Akou s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des pièces de pagnes, Akou demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire.
texts.en:
Akou lives in Agoè and is 47 years old. Married, Akou is the mother of three children and works hard to foster their education. She sells brightly colored African print cloth in her shop in the neighborhood so as to earn a living for her family. She stocks up twice a month in the market. 

To order some lengths of cloth, Akou is asking for this loan so that she can complete her purchase and manage to earn her livelihood from it.

loans.use: to buy eight lengths of brightly colored African print cloth

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Etant une femme divorcée, Yawavi vit à Agoe avec ses quatre enfants. Agée de 38 ans, Yawavi est une commerçante de poissons fumés qui circule dans tout son quartier et satisfait agréablement ses clients. Yawavi trouve son revenu à travers ce commerce. Yawavi s’approvisionne dix fois par mois au marché de Lomé. Pour commander des cartons de poissons, Yawavi sollicite ce microcrédit pour réaliser son achat afin d’avoir le bénéfice qui pourrait soutenir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
A divorced woman, Yawavi lives in Agoe with her four children.  Aged 38, she is a seller of smoked fish who walks pleasantly around her neighborhood, selling fish and satisfying the needs of her customers. This is how Yawavi earns her livelihood. She stocks up 10 times a month in a market in Lomé. 

To order some cartons of fish, Yawavi is requesting this small loan so that she can complete her purchase and earn the income to support the education of her children. (Note: Yawavi's tray with dried fish is balanced on a wall in the photo and Yawavi is standing behind it.)

loans.use: to buy two cartons of fish

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”.
El socio es el Sr. Francisco, el socio continua  dedicándose al negocio de  agricultura y se dedica  a sembrar maíz entre otros, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio Francisco requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Virgen Concebida de Arin.” 
The member is Francisco. He continues devoting himself to the business of agriculture and works to plant corn, among other things. The member has had his business for a long time which is doing well thanks to the hard work that he puts into it each day. The member hopes to continue working in this way in order to keep supporting his family. The member Francisco requires a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. 
The member is grateful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling his repayments according to the agreed payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, gravel, sand and metal sheets to cement the walls and change the roof of her house

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower, 35, has three children, aged 12, 4, and 8 months. She lives with her husband, children, and extended family, several of whom were affected by TB. Sadly, three of her siblings passed away. 

When the borrower’s oldest son was 2 years old, she fell ill and had to undergo surgery and a difficult two-year treatment. She was able to overcome her illness due to her commitment to treatment and, as soon as she recovered, started a small business on her own.    

In 2010, she started selling school supplies outside her home. Her small business was doing well but she needed capital to install her own bookstore at home, which she opened with a small loan from Partners In Health, Peru. 

The family’s income improved until 2014, when her husband lost his job and they had to rely only on the store to cover their expenses. Through careful management of their finances, the borrower has been able to pull through, but now she wishes to expand her business through the purchase of a photocopier, as photocopies are in great demand in her neighborhood and there are no photocopy businesses in the area.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier for convenience store

loans.name: Annalisa

texts.en:
Annalisa is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Annalisa is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Annalisa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Annalisa requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Annalisa has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Annalisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is married with two children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.

Loida supports her family through her aquaculture business: farming oysters in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her son Kenneth Brian, who is 15 years old and is the first of two children in the family. He is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently in the 1st of this 4-year course.

Loida is borrowing PHP 27,000 to pay for tuition fees of her son Kenneth Brian for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When he graduates, Kenneth Brian plans to help his parents earn an income to send his brother and sister in college.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cristina is 41 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Cristina has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Cristina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower, 50, is a single mother with three daughters, ranging in age from 14 to 24. In 2010, she began a small business as a food vendor at a local market but had to quit in 2012 after she was diagnosed with TB. 

She responded well to treatment and decided to get back to work before completing it. Unfortunately, she relapsed and her medical treatment became much more difficult. 

The borrower needed care and assistance so her older daughters moved in with her. In March 2015, she completed treatment and decided to start a small business selling sandwiches. Her daughters are working with her. She needs a small loan to purchase materials and ingredients to expand her sales.

loans.use: To expand the food stand

loans.name: Norielyn

texts.en:
Norielyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Norielyn is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Norielyn has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Norielyn requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bamboo, and other supplies.

Norielyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Norielyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bamboo and other supplies for her nipa roofing business

loans.name: Burulhan

texts.ru: Бурулхан, 53 года, замужем, 2 детей. На протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день Бурулхан смогла развить свою деятельность, у нее есть корова, лошадь. Супруг и дети активно и с удовольствием помогают по хозяйству. На участке мерою 3,0 Га она выращивает люцерну, рис, пшеницу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для выращивания органического риса и пшеницы. Доходы от кредита Бурулхан планирует направить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Burulhan is 53 years old, married, and has 2 children. Over the last 15 years, she has been raising animals and growing crops. Burulhan has been able to expand her business, and now she has a cow and a horse. Her husband and children actively and gladly help around the farm. She grows alfalfa, rice, and wheat on a plot of land measuring 3.0 hectares. 

In order to further expand her business, Burulhan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to grow organic rice and wheat. Burulhan plans to use the profits from the loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: to cultivate her land to grow organic rice and wheat.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vicky is 36 years old and has two children are still in school.

Vicky has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Vicky requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials to her business.

Vicky has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials to her dried fish business

loans.name: Glocita

texts.en:
Glocita, a 56-year-old married mother of six children, one of whom is in school, is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has been operating a general store business in the Philippines for six years. 

Glocita has requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is widowed with five children and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

Violeta requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials to her business.

Violeta has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her dried fish business

loans.name: Recy

texts.en:
Recy is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Recy is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Recy has a nipa making business in the Philippines. Recy requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, etc..

Recy has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Recy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks for her nipa weaving business

loans.name: Ndungiri Muthingi Water Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Agnes, a member of Ndungiri Muthingi Water Women Group. She is married and blessed with one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. 
Agnes is a mixed farmer who grows maize, potatoes and rear goats and sheep. 

She is borrowing from Kiva in order to buy fertilizer and seeds to increase her farm produce and income from the sale of potatoes and maize to her customers. She hopes this extra income will enable her cater for her family’s needs such as food, shelter and school fees for her children.

Agnes is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to increase her farm produce and income from the sale of potatoes and maize

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Concebida De Arin”.
La socia alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose a la  agricultura y ganadería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia Martha agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the communal bank “Virgen Concebida de Arin.”  She alternates her daily activities working in agriculture and raising livestock.  She has been doing this business for a good amount of time and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts every day into her business.  She wishes to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and manure.

Martha is grateful for the loan and commits to making her loan payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy iron sheets for cow shed roof for environmental conditions for her dairy cows so better production and buy new clothing for her family.

loans.name: Magha Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Edith. She is 46 years old married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training and especially enterprise development.

She practices mixed farming. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy manure and animal feeds to increase her crop and dairy production. This will enable her earn more income to pay for her children’s school fees and buying better clothing for them.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure and animal feeds to increase crop and dairy production for good income to pay school fees and buy good clothing for her children.

loans.name: Kuibanga Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Leah; a member of Kuibanga Women Group. She is 43 years old, married and living with her four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings and especially enterprise development.

She practices mixed farming, where she does crop, dairy and poultry farming. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds and chicken feeds so as to increase her dairy and poultry production. With increased income, she will be able to feed her family, provide good clothing and pay school fees.

She is much grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: buy dairy and chicken feeds to increase dairy and poultry production hence earn more income to provide food, clothing and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Gwitirithia Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her arm holding a passbook in the photo is called Emily; a member of Gwitirithia Group. She is 43 years old, married and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings and especially enterprise development. 

Her economic activity is mixed farming ; she keeps dairy, poultry and does crop farming. She also does tailoring to supplement her income. 

She is taking a Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds to increase milk production hence more income and use profits to support her tailoring business by buying tailoring cloth. With increased incomes, she will be able to pay school fees for her children at ease.

Emily is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds to increase milk production to use profits to buy cloth for her tailoring business for better income and pay school fees.

loans.name: Aikokul

texts.ru: Айкокул, 28 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, много лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 8 овец, также земельный надел мерою 0,57 ГА, где она выращивает кукурузу. Супруг помогает Айкокул в ведении ее бизнеса. Есть все условия для содержания скота. Айкокул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания органической кукурузы. Своевременная обработка почвы приведет к увеличению объемов сбора урожая и увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Айкокул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и строительство дома.
texts.en:
Aikokul is 28 and married with three children. She has a high school education and has been working in agriculture for many years. She currently has six cows and eight sheep on her farm as well as 0.57 hectares of land where she grows corn. Her husband helps her with the business and she has everything she needs to care for livestock.

Aikokul has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate her land and grow organic corn. By amending the soil in this way she will receive a better harvest and improve her family's income. She plans to put profits form the loan into further developing her business and building a house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to cultivate her land and grow organic corn

loans.name: Zhamiyla

texts.ru: Жамийла, 41 год, не замужем, мать 2 детей. У Жамийлы высшее образование, на протяжении 4 лет занимается торговлей, полеводством, у нее развитое хозяйство. Есть 2,92 Га земли, где Жамийла выращивает экологически-чистый картофель для реализации, также в арендованном помещении магазина, она продает верхнюю одежду и обувь. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет около 16,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жамийла обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян картофеля. Доходы Жамийла планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zhamiyla is 41 years old, not married, and is the mother of 2 children. Zhamiyla has a post-secondary education, and over the last 4 years has worked in sales, and also raises crops on her well-developed farm. Zhamiyla grows organic potatoes for resale on 2.92 hectares of land, and she sells outerwear and shoes at a rented shop location. Her monthly combined income is about 16,500 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her business, Zhamiyla has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer and seed potatoes. Zhamiyla plans to use the profits to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers in order to grow organic potatoes.

loans.name: Maria Ingracia

texts.es:
A pesar de su edad, María es una mujer fuerte y trabajadora, no se deja rendir por las adversidades pues sabe que todo en la vida tiene una solución. Ella tiene 10 años de haber comenzado una pequeña pulpería, en la que también vende productos lácteos como cremas, leche y cuajadas. Este es el principal sustento de su hogar, porque gracias a la calidad de sus productos, las ganancias sos jugosas.  
Sin embargo, María solicita un préstamo para comprar leche y la materia prima para la elaboración de las cuajadas, esto le será de ayuda porque podrá ofrecer productos de calidad. En consiguiente, atraerá más clientes y se dará a conocer en la zona. Ella planea con las ganancias mejorar su vivienda y continuar invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
in spite of her age, Maria is a strong and hardworking woman who does not give up when facing adversity. She knows that everything in life has a solution. 

Maria opened a small convenience store 10 years ago. She sells dairy products such as cream, milk and curd. This is her family's primary source of income. Earnings are good thanks to the qualify of her products.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy milk and other ingredients for making curd. This will help her as she will be able to offer quality products, attract more customers and make her better known in the region. With the additional earnings, she plans to improve her home and continue investing on her business.

loans.use: to buy milk and other ingredients for making curd.

loans.name: Dilarom

texts.ru: Диларом, 52 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. Образование - среднее. Уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Диларом достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 23,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Диларом имеется 0,95 Га собственной земли, где Диларом выращивает картофель и саженцы фруктовых деревьев для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Диларом обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для выращивания органических саженцев. Доходы от кредита Диларом планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Dilarom is 52 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. She has a secondary education. For many years, she has been raising animals and crops. Thanks to her extremely hard work and unending labor, Dilarom has had a lot of success with developing her farm, and now has a monthly income of 23,000 som (KGS). Dilarom now has 0.95 hectares of her own land on her farm, where she raises potatoes and fruit tree saplings for resale. 

In order to further develop her farm, Dilarom has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer for growing organic saplings. She plans to use the profits from her loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow organic saplings for resale.

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es:
Hilarion es un hombre de 55 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos varones de 18 y 31 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 6 y 15 años, y su negocio es la carpintería.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, activo, constante, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘16 de julio’ caracterizada por concentrar la mayor cantidad de comerciantes y compradores en Latinoamérica. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Hilarion es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a labores de casa y con sus 3 hijos menores que estudian en la escuela y su hijo mayor es independiente. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas natural y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la carpintería, él se encarga de fabricar muebles de hogar como; juegos de comedor, sillas, mesas, y otros muebles., actividad que realiza en su domicilio durante todos los días de semana, “me inicie en el rubro como ayudante en una empresa grande, tuve la oportunidad de independizarme y abrí mi  carpintería…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos que le hacen pedidos, la desventaja es la falta de madera para que su negocio camine. Su sueño es ser un proveedor mayorista, él desea realizar la compra de madera para fabricar roperos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 17 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Hilarion solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera para fabricar roperos para distribuir por mayor.
texts.en:
55-year old Hilarion is married and has two sons aged 18 and 31 and two daughters aged 6 and 15. He is a carpenter.

Hilarion is a good father, enterprising, active, steady, responsible and hardworking. His business is located in the July 16th neighbourhood which is known to have the highest concentration of sellers and buyers in Latin America. The climate is cold and dry with a daytime temperature that varies between 0 and 12C.

Hilarion is dark-skinned with brown eyes, short black hair, and is small in stature. His native language is Aymará which he speaks with his family, but he also knows Spanish for cultural and business purposes. His wife looks after the household as well as the three younger children who attend school. His oldest son has left home. They live in their own home which is made of brick and cement with a corrugated sheet roof and a wooden floor. It has water, electricity, natural gas and plumbing. 

As a carpenter Hilarion makes furniture such as dining sets, armchairs, tables, etc. He works from home every day of the week. He began as a helper in a large factory and then had the opportunity to open his own carpentry business. The good thing about his business is that he has regular customers who give him orders; the bad thing is he is short of wood and his business cannot grow.

Hilarion's dream is to be a wholesale distributor. With the loan he wishes to buy wood to make wardrobes and sell them wholesale.This is his first loan with this institution in the 17 years he's had his own business.

loans.use: to buy wood to make wardrobes and sell wholesale

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MADRES TRABAJADORAS, la socia  continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas  entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Madres Trabajadoras (Hard-working Mothers) communal bank, and still has her business selling fruit. She has been in her business for some time, and it is going well thanks to the efforts she puts into it each day. She wishes to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family in this way.

She is grateful for the loan granted, and promised to make her installment payments.

The member is requesting the loan in order to buy oranges and other fruit.

loans.use: To buy oranges and other fruit.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María tiene 35 años de edad vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 14, y 5 años de edad, el cual los apoya en sus estudios, y se esfuerza mucho para que no les falte nada. Ella se dedica a la venta de helados como: charamuscas, chocobananos, paletas y fruta congelada desde hace 5 años. María ha observado que cada día son más las personas que solicitan sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bananos, mangos,  bolsas, fresas, sandia, chocolate, azúcar, jocotes y arrayán para cumplir con la demanda de productos que solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en: 35-year-old Maria lives in her own home with her partner and their two children ages 14 and 5. She supports the kids with their studies and works hard so that they have everything they need. Maria has been selling ice cream and popsicles for the past 5 years. Maria has noticed that more and more people want her products every day, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in bananas, mangoes, bags, strawberries, watermelons, chocolate, sugar, cashews and guavas to meet the demand for her products.

loans.use: to invest in bananas, mangoes, bags, strawberries, watermelons, chocolate, sugar, cashews and guavas.

loans.name: Felix Javier

texts.es:
Felix de 53 años de edad, originario de Managua, casado con dos hijos mayores de edad, independientes los cuales trabajan y tiene familia propia. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsables con ganas de superación personal, en la actualidad sigue luchando para generar sus propios ingresos y no pender de nadie. Gracias a su esfuerzo y su tenacidad ha cumplido sus sueños como ver formados a sus hijos profesionalmente.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica el servicio de una moto taxi, desde hace cuatro años puedo adquirir su propia moto taxi, ya que inicialmente trabajaba con bicicleta. Como acarreo de transporte. En la actualidad ha podido mantener el negocio y ganado clientela tanto fija como eventual. EL objetivo del crédito es darle mantenimiento a su unidad de transporte y poder cambiarle las llantas, para brindar un mejor servicio. Felix agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Felix, age 53, is from Managua. He is married and has two grown children, who are now working and have their own families. He is hard working and responsible with goals of personal improvement. Currently, he continues striving to earn his own money and be dependent upon no one. Thanks to his hard work and tenacity, he has achieved his dream of seeing his children grow up to be professionals.

As part of his dreams of getting ahead, he runs a motorcycle taxi (mototaxi) service. Four years ago he managed to buy his own motorcycle; he started out doing hauling with his bicycle. Today, he's been able to maintain his business and earn steady customers as well as passersby. His purpose for this loan is to maintain his motorcycle by changing the tires; this will help him provide his customers with better service.

Felix is grateful to Kiva investors for bringing people from poor countries with few resources the chance to do dignified work.

loans.use: buy new tires for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Zusette

texts.en:
Zusette is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a food market in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of spices and vegetables to sell in her stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Zusette dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices and vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 51 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ester has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Ester requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her dried fish business.

Ester has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ester would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Mwanzo Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising hand the photo is Tungo. She is married and blessed with eight children. She lives with her three grand children.

She joined hand in hand eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from courses on enterprise development and financial management. This improved her knowledge in business management.She has been able to advance her dairy farming through proper recording and using the profits prudently.

Tungo is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy meal that will help improve on milk productivity thus more income to meet family needs with ease.

She thanks Kiva for the support and promised to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy meal that will help improve on milk productivity thus more income to meet family needs with ease.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 35 years old with six children. With three children in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like general stores, canned goods, beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

Rosalinda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, beverages, eggs, bread, biscuits and other groceries. 

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like general stores, canned goods, beverages, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Oscar Arnulfo

texts.es:
Oscar, se dedica a desarrollar los cultivos de granos básicos y hortaliza, para poder tener parte de la alimentación familiar y para vender, de esta forma puede tener ingresos para cumplir con todos sus compromisos, contrata obreros para que le ayuden en los trabajos agrícolas, también vende café para tener ingresos extras. Es casado, actualmente vive con su esposa y dos hijos, el mayor de ellos asiste a la escuela.
Invertirá en insumos agrícolas y semilla mejorada de granos básicos y hortalizas para sembrar, así podrá ejecutar en un  tiempo prudencial las diferentes actividades agrícolas, se mantendrá trabajando y espera que las cosechas aumenten para que pueda cubrir las demandas de sus productos y atender a nuevos clientes.
Oscar trabaja muy duro para ir ampliando su negocio y así mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Oscar works in the cultivation of basic grains and vegetables, in order to take part in the family's food supply as well as to sell. In this manner, he can earn income to complete all of his debt. 

He hires laborers to help him with the agricultural work. He also sells coffee to earn extra income. 
He is married and now lives with his wife and two children, of which the older one attends school. 

He will invest the loan in agricultural ingredients and improved seeds of basic grains and vegetables. This way he could carry out different agricultural activities at the right time.  He will continue working and hopes that the harvests will increase, so that he could meet the demands of his product and to serve new customers. 

Oscar works very hard to continue expanding his business, and to improve the living of his family.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural ingredients and improved seeds of basic grain and vegetables

loans.name: Sonia Marisol

texts.es:
Sonia, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera, se dedica a la agricultura y al trabajo jornal, solo tiene un hijo y  en su casa viven sus padres y su hermano.

Sonia, se dedica a la agricultura y se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 12, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió gracias a sus padres, quienes desde muy pequeña le enseñaron.- Para desempeñar su trabajo diariamente recorre un aproximado de 2 kilómetros y su horario de trabajo es de 5 horas al día. 

Sonia, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, herbicidas y pesticidas para sembrar maíz, con esto tendrá mejores cosechas.

Ella sueña con ver a su hijo graduarse de una carrera universitaria, además, siempre mantiene el sueño de ser propietaria de un negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia, 46 years old, studied up to the third grade. She is a single mother and is dedicated to agriculture, while also working as a day laborer. She has just one child and lives in her own house with her parents and brother.

Sonia has been working in agriculture since the age of 12, and all she knows she learned thanks to her parents who taught her from the time she was very small. To do her daily work, she travels approximately two kilometers, and she works five hours a day.

Sonia needs this loan to purchase agricultural inputs such as manure, herbicides and pesticides to sow corn. With these inputs she will have better harvests.

Sonia dreams of seeing her son graduate with a university degree in a career and, in addition, she has always dreamed of being proprietor of a store.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs such as manure, herbicides, and pesticides for sowing corn.

loans.name: Blessed Mothers Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Johonden, 50 years old, married and living with her four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development.

She practices mixed farming where she keeps dairy cows and also does crop farming of maize, beans and potatoes. She is borrowing a loan to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs so as to enrich the soil and have high yields during the harvesting period. 

This will increase her production hence income levels to enable her provide better food, clothing and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and other farm inputs to enrich soil for better yields so earn more and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 24-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows tomatoes and cabbages to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Jacinta has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, seeds, a wheelbarrow, etc. 

She has been a member of SBPD since June of this year (2015). With her profits, Jacinta hopes to save it to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, seeds, a wheelbarrow, etc

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco está casado, tiene 2 hijos que ya son adultos, y a quienes ha criado con mucho esfuerzo. Francisco es vendedor ambulante, y empezó siendo un empleado en un negocio de venta de ropas.
Francisco es una persona que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar en el emprendimiento que está haciendo, es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos varios para la venta, como ser prendas variadas, calzados y artículos de mercería para poder seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
Francisco is married and has two adult children, whom he has raised with a lot of effort. Francisco is a traveling salesman, and began his career by working for a clothing sales company. 

Francisco puts his best efforts into growing and improving his business. He is a hard-working and determined person.

He is requesting this loan to invest in various products to sell, such as items of clothing, shoes and haberdashery, so that he can continue improving his business.

loans.use: to buy various items of clothing, shoes and haberdashery.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel tiene 34 años de edad y vive en casa humilde pero de su propiedad al lado de su compañera de vida y sus 5 hijos de 14, 10, 8, 6 y 1 años de edad, a los que apoya para que estudien ya que desea puedan optar a una mejor calidad de vida. Manuel presta sus servicios en una empresa cercana a su vivienda, pero además buscando obtener mejores ingresos económicos desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Por lo anterior Manuel está solicitando a FUSAI un crédito el cual pueda invertir en: fragancias para mujeres y hombres, cremas, champú, jabones, cremas para el rostro, etc.
texts.en: Manuel is 34 years old. He lives in a simple house that is his own along with his life companion and his five children aged 14, 10, 8, 6 and 1 years old. He supports them so that they study since he wants them to be able to opt for a higher quality of living. Manuel works for a company close to his house, but also, looking to obtain greater economic income, has been selling beauty products for 5 years. For this reason Manuel is requesting  a loan from FUSAI which he will invest in fragrances for women and men, lotions, shampoo, soap, facial lotion, etc.

loans.use: to invest in fragrances for women and men, lotions, shampoo, soap, facial lotion, etc.

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es: Zenon de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus 2 hijos, el se dedica a la  agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace 25 años el cual inicio con capital propio, los productos son vendidos durante todo el año en los mercados que están cerca de su casa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pesticidas, semillas, abono, fertilizantes, etc. para poder tener un buen cultivo y asi tener mejores ganancias para darle a sus hijos un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
44-year old Zenon lives in his own house with his two children. He has earned his living growing maize and beans for 25 years. He began his farm using his own capital. He sells the produce throughout the year in the markets that are near his home.

Now Zenon is seeking a loan to buy pesticide, seeds, compost, fertilizer etc. so he can get good crops and earn more money to provide his children with a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy pesticide, seeds, compost, fertilizer etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of clothing materials. 

She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Ma. Elvira

texts.en:
Her name Ma.Elizabeth, 44, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Sofronio. She works hard to provide income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her High School child. 

Ma. Elizabeth is into direct selling business. She is a distributor of Royalle Products, Filipino owned company and a major player in health, wellness and beauty products. Filipinos are learning to take care not only of their physical appearance but also o ftheir physical health. They take natural vitamins to support their well-being. Aside from being a dealer she also makes pickled papaya and "embutido" (Filipino recipe of meat loaf made special with raising, eggs, carrots) and sells them to her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php2,500 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan which she will use to buy more Royalle health, wellness and beauty products to meet the advanced order of her clients. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given her for it will surely help fund their daily sustenance and for her child's education. 

Ma. Elizabeth aims to grow her business and  be able to travel abroad with her family. She prays that God will keep her family happy and healthy. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of wellness and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pills, syrup, antibiotics and aspirin.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 58 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Gemma has a general store business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store .

Gemma has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 48 years old and married with two children. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Virginia has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 56 years old and married with one child.

Jacinta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more grocery stock to sell.

Jacinta has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from a restaurant.
